Whitelist external netifaces requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

commit_message:
Updated rhel element to support rhn

Added support for Red Hat Network (RHN) subscription. Extended to accept
list of rhn channels or repos to enable. Default subscription method
remains rhsm for backward compatibility. Also updated the default RHEL
image to the latest RHEL 6.5 image available on the Customer Portal.

Change-Id: Ia7f39bee7ae24253fa2002b3dc5b2293be3ff0bd

commit_message:
Simplify code in l2network_db_v2 by using defaultdict.

Code in l2network_db_v2.py was using an unnecessary conditional that
checked for a certain state.physical_network key in the allocations
dict. Using collections.defaultdict(set) removes this unnecessary
conditional and makes the code simpler to read.

Change-Id: I33306e8271a2613e67893894902fca588f66ecb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/03/67203/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import defaultdict allocations = defaultdict(set)
deleted_lines: allocations = dict() if state.physical_network not in allocations: allocations[state.physical_network] = set()

commit_message:
Set the keystone API version in the auth_uri

Set the keystone API version in the auth_uri config option for Ironic,
if the URI contains no version Ironic won't be able to get the service
URL from keystone.

Change-Id: I737da2be81d303fe14c3e6fdae93bd4b077dca57
Relate-Bug: #1268582

commit_message:
volume.filters(rootwrap) should not use full paths

volume.filters for rootwrap uses full paths for the
binaries, which causes a problem if the binary has
a different path. It is not needed as the rootwrap
infrastructure allows the binaries to be in all
paths specified by exec_dirs.

Change-Id: I3e2383f1025a9a08b7dd33f48da156c6d8c3cd71
Closes-Bug: #1269894

commit_message:
Add a new xml namespace XMLNS_V3 for v3 API

This patch adds a new xml namespace for v3 API. The XMLNS_V11 is
also used in v3. It makes sense to add a new XMLNS_V3 for v3 API.

Change-Id: I9a062a53b228c987913cde11dfcc3aa7dde7c56f
Partial-Bug: #1264076

commit_message:
Improve and unit-test template contents fetching

This includes some important changes in the way template
content is fetched:
* for template_file, the value is converted to a file:// URL and the
  actual fetching is performed with the URL fetching code path.
  As a consequence it is now possible to specify a file path *or*
  a URL for the --template-file command option. This is a change in
  behaviour, and it does make --template-url somewhat redundant.
  This makes the behaviour of --template-file consistent with the
  behaviour of --environment-file.
* for template_url, the content is fetched in heatclient so that
  the server does not need to fetch the template at all. This means
  that in the API request the 'template' field is populated instead
  of 'template_url'. We can consider deprecating 'template_url' from
  the REST API.

Change-Id: Id8de05973381dba7ac052c45dd074071fd3035b2

commit_message:
Move environment and template file functions to own module

This is part of a refactoring in preperation for
supporting the get_file intrinsic function.

Change-Id: If6974fc72c47e6a5c6545e65375e75cfd177fb7a

commit_message:
Set objects indirection API in network service

We need to set the
nova.objects.baseNovaObject.indirection_api global inside the network
service to point to the conductor API so that the object actions will
 be done by RPC to conductor.

Part of blueprint: nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I9e2c643eae7d09f5037485386e6ea53b75587980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/27/67527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.conductor import rpcapi as conductor_rpcapifrom nova.objects import base as objects_baseCONF.import_opt('use_local', 'nova.conductor.api', group='conductor') if not CONF.conductor.use_local: objects_base.NovaObject.indirection_api = \ conductor_rpcapi.ConductorAPI()

commit_message:
Fix up SAIO to use new gatekeeper

Fix up the SAIO default proxy-server pipeline to use the new
gatekeeper and update to follow the pipeline ordering from proxy
sample.

Change-Id: Iaa4de7abd7fc557cafe6fe40668973e9fc142ca3

commit_message:
Rename __init__.py to create_volume.py

This commit is the first step of creating packages structure for
flows. This change is required to preserve git history of renamed files
for change I63473f549f0c501fe0f373830bc1080239d01892

Change-Id: Ib5ed0e9196fa7bf4fd0b69a13c90e40c360ad8ef

subject: Adding image location selection strategies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-25 11:52:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/7f8188940ce484ff44e0b74e3fb97f5a5d92843f', 'message': 'Adding image location selection strategies

An image can be save to more then one backend storage by multi-location
mechanism, Glance should has a capability to select a best backend
storage for improve image consuming performance. This change implemented
two strategy modules: "location_order" and "store_type", and allow Admin
configure some strategy-specified options for Glance as their deployment
required.

As an end user, he can get VM or consuming image faster base on this
enhancement. This is not only for 'download' transport handling on the
API server side but also for client since they can obtain locations by
standard 'direct URL' interface. Admin 

Implements bp: image-location-selection-strategy

Change-Id: I86f192aeae8e5f21a72f946552f6507654c25a6c

commit_message:
Adding image location selection strategies

An image can be saved to more than one backend storage by multi-location
mechanism, Glance should have a capability to select the best backend
storage for improving image consuming performance. This change
implements two strategy modules: "location_order" and "store_type", and
allow Admin configure some strategy-specified options for Glance as
their deployment required.

As an end user, he can get VM or consuming image faster base on this
enhancement. This is not only for 'download' transport handling on the
API server side but also for client since they can obtain locations by
standard 'direct URL' interface.

docImpact
Implements bp: image-location-selection-strategy

Change-Id: I86f192aeae8e5f21a72f946552f6507654c25a6c
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Restore image status on duplicate image upload

Glance should not allow already uploaded images to be modified by
another upload. Currently, when configured with the local filesystem
backend, Glance prevents duplicate upload of an already uploaded image
BUT it changes the image status to "saving".

This commit adds a status transition state machine to the domain.Image
class and modifies the domain.Image.status setter function to verify
status transitions based on this state machine - only target states that
can be reached from the image's current state are permitted.

Tests have also been agumented to verify that the original image (meta)
data does not change in case of a conflicting upload.

Closes-Bug: #1241379

Change-Id: I62c5acae4c29abf0691d8279b51c59008f9c0047

exception log message

added_lines: def logging_excepthook(exc_type, value, tb): if CONF.verbose or CONF.debug: extra['exc_info'] = (exc_type, value, tb) getLogger(product_name).critical( "".join(traceback.format_exception_only(exc_type, value)), **extra)
deleted_lines: def logging_excepthook(type, value, tb): if CONF.verbose: extra['exc_info'] = (type, value, tb) getLogger(product_name).critical(str(value), **extra)

commit_message:
Sync module units from oslo

Module units landed in Nova first, then was accepted by oslo with
minor changes. This patch removes nova specific unit module and
test, replaces with module units in oslo.

commit_message:
keystone-manage to be run by keystone user/group

keystone-manage pki_setup and keystone-manage db_sync should be run by
the designated keystone user and group. The reason being that these
commands when run as root (as is the case with chef) may drop a
keystone.log file. If this is the first pass, that file will be owned
by root and subsequent writes to that file by the proper keystone user
or group will likely fail.

This change also removes a redundant test for opensuse.

Change-Id: I627674b319738f9c79ff146ddfdf979db55b2c14

Update spec files to be rubocop compliant

- Update .rubocop.yml to include spec/**

- Update spec files to be rubocop compliant

commit_message:
XenAPI: Allow use of clone_vdi on all SR types

All XenServer SR types support VDI.clone - even if they perform
an internal VDI.copy.  Always use the clone function if COW is
enabled.

Change-Id: I85c580fba43d3bb52149626419d0f0c03ed69145

subject: Add resource loader support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-27 12:44:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/3e4bf0ffdca2d9109a17d777f2e8531bf1eed5ac', 'message': "Add resource loader support

Added the resource loader interface and base classes, also the
FileResourceLoader implementation to load the resources from a YAML
file.

The new method ceilometer.resourceloader.get_resources() can find the
appropriate resource loader and use that loader to load the resources to
return.

e.g: Suppose we have a YAML file /foo/bar with the following content:

- snmp://1.1.1.1
- snmp://2.2.2.2

and for the foloowing pipeline resource definition:

resources:
    - fileloader:///foo/bar
    - ipmi://1.2.3.4

The get_resources() will use the FileResourceLoader to load the
resources from the file /foo/bar. For the other resource
'ipmi://1.2.3.4' since there is no mapping resource loader can be found,
it will assume it's the actual resource to be return. So the returned
list of get_resources() is: ['snmp://1.1.1.1', 'snmp://2.2.2.2',
'ipmi://1.2.3.4'].

Change-Id: I438ecabdcfae0a03fa89d150d31dc9fbb3aeda1f
Implements: blueprint support-resources-pipeline-item

commit_message:
Add resource loader support

Added the resource loader interface and base classes, also the
FileResourceLoader implementation to load the resources from a YAML
file.

The new method ceilometer.resourceloader.get_resources() can find the
appropriate resource loader and use that loader to load the resources to
return.

e.g: Suppose we have a YAML file /foo/bar with the following content:

- snmp://1.1.1.1
- snmp://2.2.2.2

and for the foloowing pipeline resource definition:

resources:
    - fileloader:///foo/bar
    - ipmi://1.2.3.4

The get_resources() will use the FileResourceLoader to load the
resources from the file /foo/bar. For the other resource
'ipmi://1.2.3.4', because no mapping resource loader can be found,
it will assume it's the actual resource to be return. So the returned
list of get_resources() is: ['snmp://1.1.1.1', 'snmp://2.2.2.2',
'ipmi://1.2.3.4'].

Implements: blueprint support-resources-pipeline-item
Change-Id: I438ecabdcfae0a03fa89d150d31dc9fbb3aeda1f

commit_message:
Add VirtualInterface object

Add new objects: VirtualInterface and VirtualInterfaceList.  These are
needed for converting nova-network over to use objects.

Part of blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: Idab38a2a9bd8737fcc8e112759c539b7ebad4df9

added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2014, Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import db from nova import exception from nova.objects import base from nova.objects import fields class VirtualInterface(base.NovaPersistentObject, base.NovaObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.IntegerField(), 'address': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'network_id': fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'instance_uuid': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'uuid': fields.StringField(nullable=True), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, vif, db_vif): for field in vif.fields: vif[field] = db_vif[field] vif._context = context vif.obj_reset_changes() return vif @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_id(cls, context, vif_id): db_vif = db.virtual_interface_get(context, vif_id) if db_vif: return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_vif) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_uuid(cls, context, vif_uuid): db_vif = db.virtual_interface_get_by_uuid(context, vif_uuid) if db_vif: return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_vif) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_address(cls, context, address): db_vif = db.virtual_interface_get_by_address(context, address) if db_vif: return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_vif) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_instance_and_network(cls, context, instance_uuid, network_id): db_vif = db.virtual_interface_get_by_instance_and_network(context, instance_uuid, network_id) if db_vif: return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_vif) @base.remotable def create(self, context): if self.obj_attr_is_set('id'): raise exception.ObjectActionError(action='create', reason='already created') updates = self.obj_get_changes() db_vif = db.virtual_interface_create(context, updates) self._from_db_object(context, self, db_vif) class VirtualInterfaceList(base.ObjectListBase, base.NovaObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'objects': fields.ListOfObjectsField('VirtualInterface'), } child_version = { '1.0': '1.0', } @base.remotable_classmethod def get_all(cls, context): db_vifs = db.virtual_interface_get_all(context) return base.obj_make_list(context, cls(), VirtualInterface, db_vifs) @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_instance_uuid(cls, context, instance_uuid, use_slave=False): db_vifs = db.virtual_interface_get_by_instance(context, instance_uuid, use_slave=use_slave) return base.obj_make_list(context, cls(), VirtualInterface, db_vifs)

subject: Merge db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator af5f710
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 16:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/__init__.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/db/__init__.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/665cff12dddefb75c3e8fb6c810ef76fd545ea4f', 'message': "Merge db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator af5f710

The db.sqlalchemy module was not recent with oslo-incubator.

 $ git checkout af5f71096c7bb83fe2f956588a9ec643b0d9a2f6
 $ python update.py --nodeps --base keystone \
   --dest-dir ../keystone --modules db.sqlalchemy

The af5f710 oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy contains a fix for the
following problem, which caused a regression in Keystone:

The database connection string was not marked as secret, so it
would be printed out in cleartext in the logs when config settings
were logged.

The database connection string typically contains the password
that's used to connect to the database, so it should be marked as
secret so that it doesn't get logged.

Change-Id: Ibdc63480a836646c5571a368f3c3a1d0c82d6aba
Closes-Bug: #1266590
"}]
commit_message:
Merge db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator af5f710

The db.sqlalchemy module was not recent with oslo-incubator.

 $ git checkout af5f71096c7bb83fe2f956588a9ec643b0d9a2f6
 $ python update.py --nodeps --base keystone \
   --dest-dir ../keystone --modules db.sqlalchemy

The af5f710 oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy contains a fix for the
following problem, which caused a regression in Keystone:

The database connection string was not marked as secret, so it
would be printed out in cleartext in the logs when config settings
were logged.

The database connection string typically contains the password
that's used to connect to the database, so it should be marked as
secret so that it doesn't get logged.

Change-Id: Ibdc63480a836646c5571a368f3c3a1d0c82d6aba
Closes-Bug: #1266590

commit_message:
Remove test_print_{dict,list}_unicode_without_encode

These tests do not really make sense: they expect the strutils.safe_encode()
method to fail for some reason.

Change-Id: I2ca07c06f86e4d83ae153601a0dab9a8f393f3e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/14/68114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import mock @mock.patch('keystoneclient.openstack.common.strutils.safe_encode') def test_print_list_unicode_without_encode(self, safe_encode_mock): safe_encode_mock.side_effect = lambda x, *args, **kwargs: x name = u'\u540d\u5b57' objs = [FakeObject(name)] self.assertRaises(UnicodeEncodeError, utils.print_list, objs, ['name']) @mock.patch('keystoneclient.openstack.common.strutils.safe_encode') def test_print_dict_unicode_without_encode(self, safe_encode_mock): safe_encode_mock.side_effect = lambda x, *args, **kwargs: x name = u'\u540d\u5b57' self.assertRaises(UnicodeEncodeError, utils.print_dict, {'name': name})

commit_message:
Implement notifications for trusts

Use the existing notifications wrapper to send notifications when a
trust is created or deleted. There is no need to send a notification on
a trust update since trusts are immutable. This change adds
trusts to the event_notifications.rst documentation.

Change-Id: I777ad4594ce9b93c36af675ac677cfa61524a3e7
blueprint: trust-notifications

added_lines: from keystone import notifications @notifications.created('trust') def create_trust(self, trust_id, trust, roles): """Create a new trust. :returns: a new trust """ return self.driver.create_trust(trust_id, trust, roles) @notifications.deleted('trust') def delete_trust(self, trust_id): """Remove a trust. :raises: keystone.exception.TrustNotFound """ try: self.driver.delete_trust(trust_id) except exception.NotFound: raise exception.TrustNotFound(trust_id=trust_id)

commit_message:
Remove kwargs from trust_api.create_trust

This change allows notifications to be sent using the existing
implementation and the resulting trust ID is stored in args[1], instead
of kwargs. Using args this way maintains consistency with
trust_api.delete_trust().

Change-Id: I8169b9ea6fabcd8aff864c3bf900ceb1b32676f3
Closes-Bug: #1269157

commit_message:
Nova Docker driver must remove network namespace

The docker hypervisor creates for each container a network
namespace which represents the nova network. This network
namespace must be removed/destroyed when nova instance will
be destroyed in order to cleanup the machine properly.

Change-Id: I6fa306d06fb16f8ceddb06e22566974237082759
Closes-Bug: 1261007
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/62183/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: utils.execute('ip', 'netns', 'delete', container_id, run_as_root=True) except Exception as e: msg = _('Cannot remove network namespace, netns id: {0},' ' container name: {1}') raise exception.InstanceDeployFailure(msg.format(e), container_id, instance_id=instance['name'])

commit_message:
Add instance faults during live_migrate errors

When there is an error in the compute manager relating to
live-migrate, this change ensures that an instance fault is
recorded to help debug any issues.

We also need to look at better reporting of errors to users,
but this is not in the scope of this small change.

Change-Id: Ib4f0d0aea64468a4a1495b0318fc531a7d0d4eaa

commit_message:
Simple Certificate Extension

Implement the Simple Certificate Extension for retrieving token signing
certificates from a server.

Closes-Bug: #1259011

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from keystone.common import wsgi from keystone.contrib.simple_cert import controllers class SimpleCertExtension(wsgi.ExtensionRouter): def add_routes(self, mapper): controller = controllers.SimpleCert() mapper.connect('/OS-SIMPLE-CERT/ca', controller=controller, action='get_ca_certificate', conditions=dict(method=['GET'])) mapper.connect('/OS-SIMPLE-CERT/certificates', controller=controller, action='list_certificates', conditions=dict(method=['GET']))

commit_message:
Add mapping function to keystone

Add a mapping implementation for the federation extension.
This will allow a set of rules to be added, that map
relationships between identity providers and keystone

api spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59848/

Implements: bp mapping-distributed-admin
Change-Id: Iab93dc6759f195fecd88dcdf1c635c81ad59165a

commit_message:
Identity Providers CRUD operations

Implementation of CRUD operations for:

- Identity Providers
- Protocols used to authenticate remote users (SAML, OpenId, etc)

Change-Id: I0ce62e720e797718dbfde6bfcd4b22a213985867
Implements: blueprint identity-providers

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from keystone.common import sql from keystone import config from keystone.tests import test_backend_sql CONF = config.CONF DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID = CONF.identity.default_domain_id class SqlFederation(test_backend_sql.SqlModels): """Set of tests for checking SQL Federation.""" def setUp(self): super(SqlFederation, self).setUp() def test_identity_provider(self): cols = (('id', sql.String, 64), ('name', sql.String, 255), ('enabled', sql.Boolean, None), ('domain_id', sql.String, 64), ('description', sql.Text, None)) # ('protocols', sql.JsonBlob, None)) self.assertExpectedSchema('identity_provider', cols) def test_identity_provider_key(self): cols = (('id', sql.String, 64), ('idp_id', sql.String, 64), ('key', sql.Text, None)) self.assertExpectedSchema('identity_provider_key', cols) def test_federated_protocol(self): cols = (('id', sql.String, 64), ('idp_id', sql.String, 64), ('mapping_id', sql.String, 64)) self.assertExpectedSchema('federation_protocol', cols)

commit_message:
Exclude weak datapoints from alarm threshold evaluation

Addresses: BP exclude-low-sample-count

To avoid alarm threshold evaluation being inappropriately skewed by
aggregates with anomalously low sample count, these weak data may be
excluded for selected alarms by setting a new 'exclude_outliers'
field on the alarm threshold rule.

An outlier in this context is considered to be an aggregate with
sample count that differs from the observed mean by more than two
standard deviations.

Change-Id: I45d05db57662588df5796a8d6864ed01d1e4165f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/61/67161/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ceilometer.alarm.evaluator import utils # when exclusion of weak datapoints is enabled, we extend # the look-back period so as to allow a clearer sample count # trend to be established look_back = (cls.look_back if not alarm.rule.get('exclude_outliers') else alarm.rule['evaluation_periods']) (alarm.rule['evaluation_periods'] + look_back)) if alarm.rule.get('exclude_outliers'): mean = utils.mean(statistics, 'count') stddev = utils.stddev(statistics, 'count', mean) bounds = dict(lower=mean - 2 * stddev, upper=mean + 2 * stddev) inliers, outliers = utils.anomolies(statistics, 'count', **bounds) if outliers: LOG.warning('excluded weak datapoints with sample counts %s', [s.count for s in outliers]) statistics = inliers else: LOG.info('no excluded weak datapoints') statistics = statistics[-alarm.rule['evaluation_periods']:]
deleted_lines: (alarm.rule['evaluation_periods'] + cls.look_back)) Ultimately this will be the hook for the exclusion of chaotic datapoints for example. statistics = statistics[:alarm.rule['evaluation_periods']]

commit_message:
Exit expirer earlier if db-ttl is disabled

Now, the ceilometer-expirer exit without doing the backend db request if
the db-ttl is disabled.

Fixes bug #1270760

Change-Id: I49580be14cd932317ff30070aeec391ef456712e

commit_message:
Python 3: call functions from memcache_crypt.py with bytes as input

These functions expect bytes as input, but in Python 3 they were given text
strings.

Change-Id: I3e2a17d35eb12f74546a9ec973c1945629833cc6

commit_message:
Remove unused token.valid index

Because valid is only ever used in conjunction with expires, we do not
need it to have its own index now that there is a covering compound
index for expires and valid.

Note that he expires index is still useful alone for purging old tokens
as we do not filter for valid in that case.

Change-Id: Ib8ac2ab740b480f8ab29c07e66247f4fce15150b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/05/59905/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set the SQL Float precision

By default mysql use a precision of 23 to store a Float and
sqlite/postgresql use 53.

The patch set the precision of Float to 53 to force all sql backends to
use the same double precision.

Change-Id: I36680ed180999e401e45428af068fd32126247da

commit_message:
add the validation of MaxSize ,MinSize and DesiredCapacity

* check whether MinSize is less than MaxSize
* check whether MinSize and MaxSize is not less than 0
* if DesiredCapacity is offered,check whether it is between
  MinSize and MaxSize

Change-Id: I79a7b6c0e61f109ac7e71d3fd48d93fb741bbc64
Closes-Bug: #1270070
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/18/67618/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # check validity of group size min_size = int(self.properties[self.MIN_SIZE]) max_size = int(self.properties[self.MAX_SIZE]) if max_size < min_size : msg = _("MinSize can not be greater than MaxSize") raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) if min_size < 0 : msg = _("The size of AutoScalingGroup can not be less than zero") raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) if self.properties[self.DESIRED_CAPACITY] : desired_capacity = int(self.properties[self.DESIRED_CAPACITY]) if desired_capacity < min_size or desired_capacity > max_size : msg = _("DesiredCapacity must be between MinSize and MaxSize") raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg)

commit_message:
Always specify preserve_ephemeral on server rebuild

Heat unit tests currently fail with git master novaclient. Without
this change all heat gating will fail as soon as novaclient 2.16.0 is
released.

Ideally the test mox should handle preserve_ephemeral being specified or not
but it is not obvious that this is possible. Novaclient rebuild has a kwargs
so always specifying preserve_ephemeral should not have any issues with
older novaclient.

Change-Id: Ieba9d19fefa77faf91b1d55bfbaa6797aeaa1fee
Closes-Bug: #1271367
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/94/68294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
remove Nova v3 XML testing

this removes the XML base clients, as well as skips any Nova v3
XML tests so that we can actually propose the patch to remove
v3 XML from Nova.

Part of bp:remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: I68ff62846346bac94a3b91366aa03f022f3f32b7

subject: Make test_poll_volume_usage_with_data more reliable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 21:06:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7e18d67cc9c96a14e0ca24a41820441e41457738', 'message': "Make test_poll_volume_usage_with_data more reliable

This test includes 2 calls to time.time().  It assumes that the result
from the second call may be greater than the first.  This isn't
definietly true and we see periodic failures of this test in the gate as
a result.

Change the test to not worry about the specific time value that gets
set.  We set _last_vol_usage_poll to 0 before calling the function under
test.  We really only need to check that it got set to some value after
calling the function under test.  This tweak should make the test pass
consistently.

Change-Id: I6c01d2958cf671c29622562689a15ca1ddea0a3c
Closes-bug: #1270693
"}]
commit_message:
Make test_poll_volume_usage_with_data more reliable

This test includes 2 calls to time.time().  It assumes that the result
from the second call may be greater than the first.  This isn't
definietly true and we see periodic failures of this test in the gate as
a result.

Change the test to not worry about the specific time value that gets
set.  We set _last_vol_usage_poll to 0 before calling the function under
test.  We really only need to check that it got set to some value after
calling the function under test.  This tweak should make the test pass
consistently.

Change-Id: I6c01d2958cf671c29622562689a15ca1ddea0a3c
Closes-bug: #1270693
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/68768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertTrue(self.compute._last_vol_usage_poll > 0,

commit_message:
Re-write sqlite BigInteger mapping test

This test makes sure that our hook that compiles BigInteger() into
INTEGER for sqlite instead of BIGINT is working as we expect.
Unfortunately, we've seen some problems running the sqlite command to
check the schema.

This patch rewrites the test to only use sqlalchemy APIs and avoid
calling out to the sqlite command for verification.

Change-Id: Id3964d0dd5b0ddf08ab745d6878840ff06b2f0dd
Closes-bug: #1271331

commit_message:
Allow flow to be specified as anonymous

In order to allow anonymous flows, which will
not be tracked in the logbook or flow_details
we need a way to not have a way to specify these
types of anonymous flows.

To accomplish this allow for a flow name to be
non-existent (but enforce that the root flow must
have a name) or to allow passing in a anonymous
constructor arg when creating a flow.

Change-Id: Ia914586ec993b5a1a0ae61a9dfbd3b27e8a5d9cd

commit_message:
Attach projects to programs

List projects (repositories) attached under each program. Also tracks
if a given project in a program is integrated or incubated.

PTLs oversee projects under their program. Contributing to a project
attached to a program gives you the right to participate in that program
PTL election.

All openstack*/* projects are assigned to a program, except:
- openstack/openstack, openstack/governance and openstack/requirements
  which are affecting everyone (so under the TC supervision)
- openstack-dev/openstack-qa, openstack/melange,
  openstack/openstack-chef, and openstack/python-melangeclient which
  should move to some attic
- openstack-dev/sandbox and openstack/python-openstackclient which
  should be in stackforge

Change-Id: Iac3b71f56e138b582f4f8d1a1abfa1068ac46c55

commit_message:
Add RPC method for node maintenance mode

Method 'change_node_maintenance_mode' added to manager and rpcapi.
This method triggered maintenance mode for a node.
New column 'maintenance' added to nodes table.

Partial-Bug: #1260099
Change-Id: I945a1ce72c04e5ee2a9427a58dae72b0719c160f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/11/62711/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1.6 - Added change_node_maintenance_mode. RPC_API_VERSION = '1.6' def change_node_maintenance_mode(self, context, node_id, mode): """Set node maintenance mode on or off. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param mode: "on" or "off". :returns: a node object. :raises: NodeMaintenanceFailure. """ return self.call(context, self.make_msg('change_node_maintenance_mode', node_id=node_id, mode=mode))

commit_message:
Updates common.check_for_exceptions and its calls

Reasons:
- exceptions.from_response has 3 arguments but is being called with
  one argument less, which is url.

Changes:
- Updated common.check_for_exceptions to support urls as needed by
  troveclient.openstack.common.apiclient.exceptions.from_response.
- Adds url to exceptions.from_response calls in troveclient.

Closes-Bug: #1266239

Change-Id: Ie18c90349479f740369f63c48a8d9b463641f84d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/03/65003/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: resp, body = self.api.client.delete("/backups/%s" % backup_id) if resp.status_code in (422, 500): raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body)

commit_message:
make datastore_version_id required

The datastore addition didn't migrate existing instances,
which causes existing installations to blow up after upgrading.
This commit addresses that by inserting best-guess dummy data
into the db.  Operators will need to clean up the values to match
their actual usage.

Change-Id: I7ae064cea9b654a4501b91877b779fb4073623af
Closes-Bug: #1259642

commit_message:
Changes encoding from 'ascii' to 'utf-8'

Reasons:
- Heat code, while encoding the template encodes it with 'ascii'
  encoding, which should be 'utf-8' instead.

Changes:
- Encoding format changed from 'ascii' to 'utf-8'.

Closes-Bug: #1272053
Change-Id: I66a7c20716899144653b7dbc6811c268caaf7c2c

commit_message:
Change default os_config_files location

Os-collect-config will change its' default in this change:

I78b3851b35addfc16913e3cd53c9d0e7eb3d191a

We will need to also follow suit. We print a deprecation warning on
fall back to the old path so that users do not depend on the old path
working forever.

Change-Id: I4fe6e66716b83b202f4ddd5b6870eda448b4c6c8

reboot, servers may need what was in the cfn config to restore complex
network configurations.

We introduce a new command line option, --backup-cachedir, that will
default to the old path, /var/run/os-collect-config. This will keep

commit_message:
Move default cache dir to persistent location

While this is called a "cache", it is important for it to survive. On
reboot, servers may need what was in the cfn config to restore complex
network configurations.

We introduce a new command line option, --backup-cachedir, that will
default to the old path, /var/run/os-collect-config. This will keep
things working for any tools that have been hard coded to use the old
path.

Change-Id: I78b3851b35addfc16913e3cd53c9d0e7eb3d191a

commit_message:
Rename generate-interfaces-file.sh...

Rename generate-interfaces-file.sh to dhcp-all-interfaces.sh
so that it is easier to find/remember in the $PATH on a deployed
image.

Also, on some distros the script actually generates many files
so the previous name was a bit confusing.

Change-Id: I7152fa7c28e8ade251311da2cd5f75972423b66c

commit_message:
Make copy_required_libs() more robust

On some systems ldd gives a slightly different output for VDSOs. It doesn't
contain a '=>'. E.g.:
   linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007fff2f4a6000)
instead of:
   linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007fff2f4a6000)
This patch simply skips all entries in the ldd output which don't expand to a
path name to workaround that.

Change-Id: Ie37637890b775b36bb31af4e586e61131bd80fa8

commit_message:
Only configure DHCP for real interfaces

Updates the generate-interfaces-file.sh script in
the dhcp-all-interfaces element so that we only
add interfaces that have real MAC addresses.

The generate-interfaces-file.sh script is run early enough
in the boot process (before OVS is initialized) that this
isn't usually a problem unless you execute it manually by hand
after booting. Then you'll end up with network/DHCP
configs for all of your OVS bridges, etc. This
patch avoids configuring all of the virtual interfaces
which have generated MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I7a705084aa5b11305ac0ec5ca37fd2e87a2ae8b7
Closes-bug: 1239479

commit_message:
WIP: Make rabbitmq-server keep state in /mnt/state

Note that it was not using an o-r-c script to be restarted because it
didn't have any config files that might change. We've added one to move
the state now, so we need to restart it.

WIP as this is untested entirely.

Change-Id: I8e12b7e84a355f50b55413a391a4b1c58428af82

This adds a new group of commands : 'rally use'
the first implemented is 'rally use deployment <deploy_id>'

As it is not possible in python to export globaly an env var,it saves the
variable in a file at ~/.rally/deployment like :
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT=1234abcd

For each command that takes a deploy_id as parameter, this
parameter is now optional.

The algorithm to find the deploy_id is as follows :
- If the --deploy-id param is set, use it
- If the environ contains the key 'RALLY_DEPLOYMENT', use it
- load the content of ~/.rally/deployment and if it contains the key
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT, use it
- Else, raise an InvalidArgumentException

Partially implements blueprint: rally-use-command

Change-Id: I1e62e26d259bd9e81f1c008058ee9ce91cc3290c

parameter is now optional.

- If the --deploy-id param is set, use it
- If the environ contains the key 'RALLY_DEPLOYMENT', use it
- load the content of ~/.rally/deployment and if it contains the key
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT, use it
- Else, raise an InvalidArgumentException

It also removes all ..._no_deploy_id tests that are now all
grouped in test_get_deployment_id_with_exeception

Partially implements blueprint: rally-use-command

commit_message:
Add rally use command

This adds a new group of commands : 'rally use'
the first implemented is 'rally use deployment <deploy_id>'

As it is not possible in python to export globaly an env var,it saves the
variable in a file at ~/.rally/deployment like :
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT=1234abcd

For each command that takes a deploy_id as parameter, this
parameter is now optional.

The algorithm to find the deploy_id is as follows :
- If the --deploy-id param is set, use it
- If the environ contains the key 'RALLY_DEPLOYMENT', use it
- load the content of ~/.rally/deployment and if it contains the key
RALLY_DEPLOYMENT, use it
- Else, raise an InvalidArgumentException

Note that I have not been able to use the default arg in @cliutils.args
because it is called before the effective method call. Setting
deploy_id=envutils.default_deployment_id() has the same problem

Partially implements blueprint: rally-use-command

Change-Id: I1e62e26d259bd9e81f1c008058ee9ce91cc3290c

commit_message:
Add os-svc-restart

Add os-svc-restart, a helper script to restart a service. It uses
map-services to figure out the actual service name, as the service name
can differ based on the distro being used and also if installing from
source or packages.  Currently, only if the init system is systemd will
a call out to map-services be done. This matches the pattern from
install-packages where map-packages is not used on dpkg systems since
those package names are used as the default in the source install
scripts.

Having a helper script will avoid the proliferation of the following
pattern everywhere:

service foo restart || service foo-by-another-name restart

This also significantly reduces errors in the log due to the above,
which can be misleading.

Depends on Change-Id: Ie7b2dcfa7cabd887d5c212df110d90f9d00a7f65

Change-Id: I15eb2a5db4b0a08e1fb40bda640cd8f224939a92

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2013 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -eu usage() { echo "Usage: os-svc-restart -n SERVICENAME" echo "" echo " -h Show help and exit" echo " -n SERVICENAME Name of job/service file." echo "" } SERVICENAME=${SERVICENAME:-""} nshift=0 while getopts "hn:" opt; do case "$opt" in n) SERVICENAME=$OPTARG;; h) usage; exit 0;; \?) usage; exit 1;; :) usage; exit 1;; esac done shift $(($OPTIND-1)) if [ -z "$SERVICENAME" ] ; then usage fi function restart_upstart_service { local name=$1 service $name restart } function restart_systemd_service { local name=$1 systemctl restart $(map-services $1).service } # TODO: SysV init fallback support DIB_INIT_SYSTEM=$(dib-init-system) if [ "$DIB_INIT_SYSTEM" == "upstart" ]; then restart_upstart_service $SERVICENAME elif [ "$DIB_INIT_SYSTEM" == "systemd" ]; then restart_systemd_service $SERVICENAME fi

map-services is not only distro specific, it also needs to be able to
handle different service names for a given distro based on source vs
package installs, since the service names may be different. This is done
via a simple check if the requested service is defined, if it is, we
print the requested name, otherwise, we print the mapped name.

Currently only implemented for Fedora. Support for other distros is
easily implemented just like map-packages.

commit_message:
Add map-services

map-services is used by os-svc-restart from Change-Id:
I15eb2a5db4b0a08e1fb40bda640cd8f224939a92

map-services is not only distro specific, it also needs to be able to
handle different service names for a given distro based on source vs
package installs, since the service names may be different. This is done
via a simple check if the requested service is defined, if it is, we
print the requested name, otherwise, we print the mapped name.

Currently only implemented for Fedora. Support for other distros is
easily implemented just like map-packages.

Change-Id: Ie7b2dcfa7cabd887d5c212df110d90f9d00a7f65

added_lines: #!/bin/env python # Copyright 2012 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # Copyright 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import sys # Manually maintained for brevity; consider making this compiled from # distromatch or other rich data sources. # Debian name on the left, Fedora on the right. service_map = { 'glance-api': 'openstack-glance-api', 'glance-reg': 'openstack-glance-registry', 'heat-api': 'openstack-heat-api', 'heat-api-cfn': 'openstack-heat-api-cfn', 'heat-api-cloudwatch': 'openstack-heat-api-cloudwatch', 'heat-engine': 'openstack-heat-engine', 'keystone': 'openstack-keystone', 'nova-conductor': 'openstack-nova-conductor', 'nova-api': 'openstack-nova-api', 'nova-cert': 'openstack-nova-cert', 'nova-scheduler': 'openstack-nova-scheduler', 'nova-consoleauth': 'openstack-nova-consoleauth', 'nova-compute': 'openstack-nova-compute', 'swift-proxy': 'openstack-swift-proxy', } for arg in sys.argv[1:]: # We need to support the service name being different when installing from # source vs. packages. So, if the requested service file already exists, # just use that. if os.path.exists('/lib/systemd/system/%s.service' % arg): print arg else: print(service_map.get(arg, arg)) sys.exit(0)

Change-Id: Ib31f65e430e4198403a6bd066173ad9b9cb8d192
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2014-01-09 01:45:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/taskflow/commit/2319ccd57c3e542ae97b4f701d08a3e85c5714ae', 'message': "Add action engine scoping ability

Add the ability to have a action engine track the
scopes of the tasks it is executing with and have
the tasks which are executed be in different storage
units. Each task has an associated storage unit which
it will use to load and store its own results and the
engine knows the full set of storage units which can
be used to lookup task requirements (which may be in
a different storage unit than task is, ie creating a
set of storage unit scopes).

By default, disable scoped usage to retain backwards
compatibility, but allow it to be provided via engine
configuration to allow those who want to use this the
ability to use it.

Backwards incompatible changes:

* Action engine no longer provides a 'storage' property
  but instead provides a root_storage and a dict property
  at 'storage_units' which can be used to get the storage
  unit for the root flow and the later can be used to get
  storage units for an nested flows.
* Engine helpers no longer takes a flow_detail as it is now
  possible to have more than one flow_detail/storage unit being
  used at the same time (a flow_detail maps 1:1 to a storage unit,
  and since we can now have multiple storage units active it no
  longer makes sense as part of that api).
* Engine helps now compiles the engine before returning, this
  allows for injecting of the 'store' dictionary which can
  only be accomplished after compilation (especially if scoping
  is used, since the root storage may be created during compilation).
* Engine base no longer takes a flow_detail as this does not make
  sense for engines which use or create more than one flow detail

Change-Id: Ib31f65e430e4198403a6bd066173ad9b9cb8d192
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-01-09 01:50:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/taskflow/commit/8f45f85250aef77bbc4c0447d97032a5708b2e10', 'message': "Add action engine scoping ability

Add the ability to have a action engine track the
scopes of the tasks it is executing with and have
the tasks which are executed be in different storage
units. Each task has an associated storage unit which
it will use to load and store its own results and the
engine knows the full set of storage units which can
be used to lookup task requirements (which may be in
a different storage unit than task is, ie creating a
set of storage unit scopes).

By default, disable scoped usage to retain backwards
compatibility, but allow it to be provided via engine
configuration to allow those who want to use this the
ability to use it.

Backwards incompatible changes:

* Action engine no longer provides a 'storage' property
  but instead provides a root_storage and a dict property
  at 'storage_units' which can be used to get the storage
  unit for the root flow and the later can be used to get
  storage units for an nested flows.
* Engine helpers no longer takes a flow_detail as it is now
  possible to have more than one flow_detail/storage unit being
  used at the same time (a flow_detail maps 1:1 to a storage unit,
  and since we can now have multiple storage units active it no
  longer makes sense as part of that api).
* Engine helps now compiles the engine before returning, this
  allows for injecting of the 'store' dictionary which can
  only be accomplished after compilation (especially if scoping
  is used, since the root storage may be created during compilation).
* Engine base no longer takes a flow_detail as this does not make
  sense for engines which use or create more than one flow detail

Change-Id: Ib31f65e430e4198403a6bd066173ad9b9cb8d192

By default, disable scoped usage to retain backwards
compatibility, but allow it to be provided via engine
configuration to allow those who want to use this the
ability to use it.

Action engine no longer provides just a 'storage' property
but also provides a 'storages' property can be used to get
all storage units for an nested flows (along with the root
flow) when scoping is turned on (the original 'storage' property
in that case just returns the root flows storage unit).

Backwards incompatible changes:
* Engine helpers no longer takes a flow_detail as it is now
  possible to have more than one flow_detail/storage unit being
  used at the same time (a flow_detail maps 1:1 to a storage unit,
  and since we can now have multiple storage units active it no
  longer makes sense as part of that api).
* Engine helpers now compiles the engine before returning, this
  allows for injecting of the 'store' dictionary which can
  only be accomplished after compilation (especially if scoping
  is used, since the root storage may be created during compilation).
* Engine base no longer takes a flow_detail as this does not make
  sense for engines which use or create more than one flow detail.

commit_message:
Add action engine scoping ability

Add the ability to have a action engine track the
scopes of the tasks it is executing with and have
the tasks which are executed be in different storage
units. Each task has an associated storage unit which
it will use to load and store its own results and the
engine knows the full set of storage units which can
be used to lookup task requirements (which may be in
a different storage unit than task is, ie creating a
set of 'visible' storage unit scopes for that task).

By default, disable scoped usage to retain backwards
compatibility, but allow it to be provided via engine
configuration to allow those who want to use this the
ability to use it.

Action engine no longer provides just a 'storage' property
but also provides a 'storages' property can be used to get
all storage units for an nested flows (along with the root
flow) when scoping is turned on (the original 'storage' property
in that case just returns the root flows storage unit).

Backwards incompatible changes:
* Engine helpers no longer takes a flow_detail as it is now
  possible to have more than one flow_detail/storage unit being
  used at the same time (a flow_detail maps 1:1 to a storage unit,
  and since we can now have multiple storage units active it no
  longer makes sense as part of that api).
* Engine helpers now compiles the engine before returning, this
  allows for injecting of the 'store' dictionary which can
  only be accomplished after compilation (especially if scoping
  is used, since the root storage may be created during compilation).
* Engine base no longer takes a flow_detail as this does not make
  sense for engines which use or create more than one flow detail.

Change-Id: Ib31f65e430e4198403a6bd066173ad9b9cb8d192

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/14/64314/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CFN An abbreviated form of `AWS CloudFormation`_. .. _AWS CloudFormation: http://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/ Constraint Defines valid input :term:`parameters` in a template. Dependency When a resource must wait for another resource to finish creation before being created itself. Heat adds an implicit dependency when a resource references another resource's output parameter. An explicit dependency can also be created using *DependsOn*. DSL An acronym for `Domain-specific language`_. .. _Domain-specific language: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain-specific_language Environment Specific details that affect or override the instantiation of the template. For example, Environment file A file where environment details are defined. Heat Orchestration Template An orchestration document, expressed in YAML, that details everything that is needed to carry out an orchestration. HOT An acronym for ":term:`Heat Orchestration Template`". Metadata An overloaded term. May refer to the `metadata service`_, `instance metadata`_, or `CFN-style template metadata`_. .. _metadata service: http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/user-data.html .. _instance metadata: http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/Create_or_Replace_Metadata-d1e5358.html .. _CFN-style template metadata: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-init.html Multi-region A feature of Heat that will support deployment to multiple regions. Nested stack A template referenced by URL inside of another template. Used to reduce redundant resource definitions and group complex architectures into logical groups. The parent stack's :term:`outputs` become the nested stack's :term:`parameters`. OpenStack Open source software for building private and public clouds. Orchestrate Arrange or direct the elements of (a situation) to produce a desired effect. Outputs A top-level block in a Heat Orchestration Template that defines what data will be returned by a stack after instantiation. Parameters A top-level block in a Heat Orchestration Template that defines what data will be passed to a stack upon stack creation and stack update. Also known as "Input parameters". Resource An orchestration artifact that represents the instantiation of a :term:`resource provider`. Resource group A resource that creates one or more identically configured nested resources. Resource provider Pluggable code that understands how to instantiate and manage a :term:`resource`. Resource attributes Data required for the instantiation of a :term:`resource`. Can be defined statically in a template or passed in as input parameters. Stack A collection of instantiated resources that are defined in a template. Stack resource A resource that allows the management of an entire stack as a resource in a parent stack. Template See :term:`Heat Orchestration Template`. Template resource A resource implemented by a nested stack. Wait condition A resource that provides a way to communicate data or events from servers back to the orchestration engine. Most commonly used to pause the creation of the stack while the server is being configured.
deleted_lines: OpenStack Open source software for building private and public clouds. orchestrate Arrange or direct the elements of (a situation) to produce a desired effect.

commit_message:
Set default adapter type for monolithic flat disks

upload_image.sh tries to find corresponding metadata in the
descriptor file for a monolithicFlat *-flat.vmdk
If this descriptor is not found, the script sets the disk_type
to preallocated but doesn't set the adapter_type.
Most of the VMs will fail booting without an adapter type.
This patch sets the adapter type to a default value: this value might
not the correct/most optimized but at least it a value is set.

Booting the example VMDK provided
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaVMware/DeveloperGuide will work.

Closes-Bug: #1271793

Change-Id: Ie3c23a4bb212f30fd078cec6b2b1d604738b595d

commit_message:
Sync request_id middleware for nova

This piece of middleware generates and attaches a request_id to
a request, to be used in completing the blueprint
cross-service-request-id for icehouse.
See change Ib4a9c404cb149d8f76bde52f7613a9596b2233b9

Change-Id: Ib0b0f19b3be332f736246b472902c6b95c1264e9
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 NEC Corporation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Middleware that ensures request ID. It ensures to assign request ID for each API request and set it to request environment. The request ID is also added to API response. """ from nova.openstack.common import context from nova.openstack.common.middleware import base ENV_REQUEST_ID = 'openstack.request_id' HTTP_RESP_HEADER_REQUEST_ID = 'x-openstack-request-id' class RequestIdMiddleware(base.Middleware): def process_request(self, req): self.req_id = context.generate_request_id() req.environ[ENV_REQUEST_ID] = self.req_id def process_response(self, response): response.headers.add(HTTP_RESP_HEADER_REQUEST_ID, self.req_id) return response

commit_message:
Add "Working with Roadmaps" chapter

A slight extension of the editor's idea to have a section on "What's
coming in Icehouse", the "Working with Roadmaps" chapter also
provides some generic information that readers can use to follow the
development of OpenStack to assist with decisions when planning their
cloud deployments.

Work in Progress.

Change-Id: Iff87786c338c9bff8d2824f099ffc09f7299a8d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/16/65616/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE appendix [ <!-- Some useful entities borrowed from HTML --> <!ENTITY ndash "–"> <!ENTITY mdash "—"> <!ENTITY hellip "…"> <!ENTITY plusmn "±"> ]> <appendix xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:id="working-with-roadmaps" label="C"> <title>Working with Roadmaps</title> <para>The good news: OpenStack has unprecedented transparency when it comes to providing information about what's coming up. The bad news: each release moves very quickly. The purpose of this chapter/section is to highlight some of the useful pages to track, and take an educated guess at what is coming up in the Ice House release and perhaps further afield.</para> <section xml:id="roadmap-information-available"> <title>Information Available to You<title> <para>status.openstack.org-->Blueprint-->Code review chain</para> </section> <section xml:id="roadmap-influencing"> <title>Influencing the roadmap</title> <para>summit, survey, bug report, etc</para> </section> <section xml:id="aspects-to-watch"> <title>Aspects to watch</title> <section xml:id="roadmap-driver-improvements"> <title>Driver quality improvements</title> <para>cinder, nova, neutron</para> </section> <section xml:id="nova-network-deprecation"> <title>Deprecation of Nova Network</title> <para>probably in Juno, not icehouse. Tell the history and status</para> </section> <section xml:id="roadmap-triple-o"> <title>OpenStack on OpenStack (TripleO)</title> <para>Continues to improve. good for greenfield deployments?</para> </section> <section xml:id="roadmap-savana"> <title>Hadoop-as-a-Service (Savana)</title> <para>much-requested/</para> </section> <section xml:id="roadmap-baremetal"> <title>Bare-metal deployment (Ironic)</title> <para>will it make it?</para> </section> <section xml:id="roadmap-trove"> <title>Database as a Service (Trove)</title> <para>will likely make it</para> </section> <section xml:id="roadmap-marconi"> <title>Messaging as a Service (Marconi)</title> <para>unlikely to make it</para> </section> </section> </appendix>

commit_message:
Use testtools as base test class

Reasons:
 - The testtools library has been chosen as the project-wide testing base
   class. It works across 2.6 and 2.7 and is a library that aims to develop
   new testing features before inclusion in the standard library. It
   enforces a few elements of correctness, such as always upcalling
   standard methods, as well as providing hooks for features such as detail
   collection and fixtures with cleanup.
Changes:
Minor tests refactoring due to use testtools:
 - fixing api/instance tests:
   tests suits are inherited from testtools.TestCase;
   fix fro skip test;

Change-Id: Iab1e2094413b0c61a665a6492617a676bf49ba89
Closes-Bug: 1179009

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/58/68758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <partintro> Designing an OpenStack cloud is a great achievement. It requires a robust understanding of the requirements and needs of the cloud users to determine the best possible configuration to meet them. OpenStack provides a great deal of flexibility to achieve your needs, and this part of the book aims to shine light on many of the decisions you will need to make during the process. </partintro>

commit_message:
Improve coherence of exceptions handling

Use specialized manager's exception the service and
add 2 new exception PluginConfigurationError and EventError.

In API error handler try to resolve errors from climate.Exception
at last chance.

Change-Id: I633a56996e5ffdfa041da132bca34fefb8e06810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/97/68397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # We obfuscate all Exceptions but Climate ones for # security reasons return internal_error(500, 'Internal Server Error', e)

commit_message:
Fix the resource_event_list method to show resource_name in URI

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-22 15:55:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/7da1d79c1fbc072133cea79b9446154d21b181c7', 'message': 'Adds exception handling to heat code

Reasons:
- In absence of exception handling code, instance status used to be
  always in BUILD state, even if heat code has error'd out.
- status "CREATE_FAILED" of heat stack should also be candidate
  of code failure and instead of executing next code,
  exception should be raised for this status.

Changes:
- Exception handling code added, which would set instance status
  to ERROR for any failures.
- If heat stack creation results in "CREATE FAILED" state,
  an exception would be raise.

commit_message:
Adds exception handling to heat code

Reasons:
- In absence of exception handling code, instance status used to be
  always in BUILD state, even if heat code has error'd out.
- status "CREATE_FAILED" of heat stack should also be candidate
  of code failure and instead of executing next code,
  exception should be raised for this status.
- Resource state should also be verified before keeping their IDs.

Changes:
- Exception handling code added, which would set instance status
  to ERROR for any failures.
- Added HEAT_STACK_SUCCESSFUL_STATUSES & HEAT_RESOURCE_SUCCESSFUL_STATES
- Heat Stack status is verified with HEAT_STACK_SUCCESSFUL_STATUSES,
  and raises exception on failure.
- Heat Resource state is verified with HEAT_RESOURCE_SUCCESSFUL_STATES,
  and raises exception on failure.

Change-Id: I307d3d6bbdcd9a46b6ea94e9673ee8d1d97e50bd
Closes-Bug: #1263496
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/36/63636/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameters = {"Flavor": flavor["name"], "VolumeSize": volume_size, "InstanceId": self.id, "ImageId": image_id, "DatastoreManager": datastore_manager, "AvailabilityZone": availability_zone} stack_name = 'trove-%s' % self.id client.stacks.create(stack_name=stack_name, template=heat_template, parameters=parameters) stack = client.stacks.get(stack_name) utils.poll_until( lambda: client.stacks.get(stack_name), lambda stack: stack.stack_status in ['CREATE_COMPLETE', 'CREATE_FAILED'], sleep_time=2, time_out=HEAT_TIME_OUT) if client.stacks.get(stack_name).stack_status == 'CREATE_FAILED': raise Exception resource = client.resources.get(stack.id, 'BaseInstance') server = novaclient.servers.get(resource.physical_resource_id) if CONF.trove_volume_support: cinderclient = create_cinder_client(self.context) resource = client.resources.get(stack.id, 'DataVolume') volume = cinderclient.volumes.get( resource.physical_resource_id) volume_info = self._build_volume(volume) self.update_db(compute_instance_id=server.id, volume_id=volume.id) else: volume_info = self._build_volume_info(volume_size) self.update_db(compute_instance_id=server.id) except Exception as e: msg = "Error creating stack using heat for instance %s" % self.id LOG.debug(_("end _create_server_volume_heat for id: %s") % self.id) err = inst_models.InstanceTasks.BUILDING_ERROR_SERVER self._log_and_raise(e, msg, err)
deleted_lines: parameters = {"Flavor": flavor["name"], "VolumeSize": volume_size, "InstanceId": self.id, "ImageId": image_id, "DatastoreManager": datastore_manager, "AvailabilityZone": availability_zone} stack_name = 'trove-%s' % self.id client.stacks.create(stack_name=stack_name, template=heat_template, parameters=parameters) stack = client.stacks.get(stack_name) utils.poll_until( lambda: client.stacks.get(stack_name), lambda stack: stack.stack_status in ['CREATE_COMPLETE', 'CREATE_FAILED'], sleep_time=2, time_out=HEAT_TIME_OUT) resource = client.resources.get(stack.id, 'BaseInstance') server = novaclient.servers.get(resource.physical_resource_id) if CONF.trove_volume_support: cinderclient = create_cinder_client(self.context) resource = client.resources.get(stack.id, 'DataVolume') volume = cinderclient.volumes.get(resource.physical_resource_id) volume_info = self._build_volume(volume) self.update_db(compute_instance_id=server.id, volume_id=volume.id) else: volume_info = self._build_volume_info(volume_size) self.update_db(compute_instance_id=server.id)

commit_message:
cleaned up module001-ch007-keystone-arch keystone-arch

added space between tenant and can

commit_message:
Add trove to command reference

Change-Id: Ie9180ecbf107f82361a7254632869cbba20cf45d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/60/68360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <section xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:id="troveclient_commands"> <!-- This file is automatically generated, do not edit --> <?dbhtml stop-chunking?> <title>trove commands</title> <para>The trove client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the OpenStack Database API and its extensions.</para> <para>For help on a specific <command>trove</command> command, enter: </para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput><command>trove</command> <option>help</option> <replaceable>COMMAND</replaceable></userinput></screen> <section xml:id="troveclient_command_usage"> <title>trove usage</title> <screen><computeroutput> [--os-password <auth-password>] [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>] [--os-tenant-id <auth-tenant-id>] [--os-auth-url <auth-url>] [--os-region-name <region-name>] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] [--database-service-name <database-service-name>] [--endpoint-type <endpoint-type>] [--os-database-api-version <database-api-ver>] [--os-cacert <ca-certificate>] [--retries <retries>] [--json] <subcommand> ...</computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_command_pos"> <title>trove positional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> <subcommand> backup-create Creates a backup. backup-delete Deletes a backup. backup-list List available backups. backup-list-instance List available backups for an instance. backup-show Show details of a backup. create Creates a new instance. database-create Creates a database on an instance. database-delete Deletes a database. database-list Lists available databases on an instance. datastore-list List available datastores. datastore-show Show details of a datastore. datastore-version-list List available versions for a datastore. datastore-version-show Show details of a datastore version. delete Deletes an instance. flavor-list Lists available flavors. flavor-show Show details of a flavor. limit-list Lists the limits for a tenant. list List all the instances. resize-flavor Resizes the flavor of an instance. resize-volume Resizes the volume size of an instance. restart Restarts the instance. root-enable Enables root for a instance. root-show Gets root enabled status for a instance. secgroup-add-rule Creates a security group rule. secgroup-delete-rule Deletes a security group rule. secgroup-list Lists all security groups. secgroup-show Shows details about a security group. show Show details of an instance. user-create Creates a user. user-delete Deletes a user from the instance. user-grant-access Grants access to a database(s) for a user. user-list Lists the users for a instance. user-revoke-access Revokes access to a database for a user. user-show Gets a user from the instance. user-show-access Gets a users access from the instance. user-update-attributes Updates a users attributes from the instance. bash-completion Print arguments for bash_completion. help Display help about this program or one of its subcommands. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_command_optional"> <title>trove optional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> --version show program's version number and exit --debug Print debugging output --os-username <auth-user-name> Defaults to env[OS_USERNAME]. --os-password <auth-password> Defaults to env[OS_PASSWORD]. --os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name> Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_NAME]. --os-tenant-id <auth-tenant-id> Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID]. --os-auth-url <auth-url> Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_URL]. --os-region-name <region-name> Defaults to env[OS_REGION_NAME]. --service-type <service-type> Defaults to database for most actions --service-name <service-name> Defaults to env[TROVE_SERVICE_NAME] --bypass-url <bypass-url> Defaults to env[TROVE_BYPASS_URL] --database-service-name <database-service-name> Defaults to env[TROVE_DATABASE_SERVICE_NAME] --endpoint-type <endpoint-type> Defaults to env[TROVE_ENDPOINT_TYPE] or publicURL. --os-database-api-version <database-api-ver> Accepts 1,defaults to env[OS_DATABASE_API_VERSION]. --os-cacert <ca-certificate> Specify a CA bundle file to use in verifying a TLS (https) server certificate. Defaults to env[OS_CACERT] --retries <retries> Number of retries. --json, --os-json-output Output json instead of prettyprint. Defaults to OS_JSON_OUTPUT </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-create"> <title>trove backup-create arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-create [--description <description>] <name> <instance> Creates a backup. Positional arguments: <name> Name of the backup. <instance> UUID of the instance. Optional arguments: --description <description> An optional description for the backup. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-delete"> <title>trove backup-delete arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-delete <backup> Deletes a backup. Positional arguments: <backup> ID of the backup. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-list"> <title>trove backup-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-list [--limit <limit>] List available backups. Optional arguments: --limit <limit> Return up to N number of the most recent backups. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-list-instance"> <title>trove backup-list-instance arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-list-instance [--limit <limit>] <instance> List available backups for an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> ID of the instance. Optional arguments: --limit <limit> Return up to N number of the most recent backups. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_backup-show"> <title>trove backup-show arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove backup-show <backup> Show details of a backup. Positional arguments: <backup> ID of the backup. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_create"> <title>trove create arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove create <name> <flavor_id> [--size <size>] [--databases <databases> [<databases> ...]] [--users <users> [<users> ...]] [--backup <backup>] [--availability_zone <availability_zone>] [--datastore <datastore>] [--datastore_version <datastore_version>] Creates a new instance. Positional arguments: <name> Name of the instance <flavor_id> Flavor of the instance Optional arguments: --size <size> Size of the instance disk in GB --databases <databases> [<databases> ...] Optional list of databases. --users <users> [<users> ...] Optional list of users in the form user:password. --backup <backup> A backup UUID --availability_zone <availability_zone> The Zone hint to give to nova --datastore <datastore> A datastore name or UUID --datastore_version <datastore_version> A datastore version name or UUID </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_database-create"> <title>trove database-create arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove database-create <instance> <name> [--character_set <character_set>] [--collate <collate>] Creates a database on an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> UUID of the instance. <name> Name of the database. Optional arguments: --character_set <character_set> Optional character set for database --collate <collate> Optional collation type for database </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_database-delete"> <title>trove database-delete arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove database-delete <instance> <database> Deletes a database. Positional arguments: <instance> UUID of the instance. <database> Name of the database. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_database-list"> <title>trove database-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove database-list <instance> Lists available databases on an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> UUID of the instance. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_datastore-list"> <title>trove datastore-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove datastore-list List available datastores. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_datastore-show"> <title>trove datastore-show arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove datastore-show <datastore> Show details of a datastore. Positional arguments: <datastore> ID of the datastore. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_datastore-version-list"> <title>trove datastore-version-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove datastore-version-list <datastore> List available versions for a datastore. Positional arguments: <datastore> ID of the datastore. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_datastore-version-show"> <title>trove datastore-version-show arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove datastore-version-show <datastore_version> [--datastore <datastore>] Show details of a datastore version. Positional arguments: <datastore_version> ID of the datastore version. Optional arguments: --datastore <datastore> ID or name of the datastore. Optional if UUID of the datastore_version is provided. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_delete"> <title>trove delete arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove delete <instance> Deletes an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> ID of the instance. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_flavor-list"> <title>trove flavor-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove flavor-list Lists available flavors. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_flavor-show"> <title>trove flavor-show arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove flavor-show <flavor> Show details of a flavor. Positional arguments: <flavor> ID of the flavor. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_limit-list"> <title>trove limit-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove limit-list Lists the limits for a tenant. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_list"> <title>trove list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove list List all the instances. </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_resize-flavor"> <title>trove resize-flavor arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove resize-flavor <instance> <flavor_id> Resizes the flavor of an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> UUID of the instance <flavor_id> Flavor of the instance </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_resize-volume"> <title>trove resize-volume arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove resize-volume <instance> <size> Resizes the volume size of an instance. Positional arguments: <instance> UUID of the instance <size> Size of the instance disk in GB </computeroutput></screen> </section> <section xml:id="troveclient_subcommand_restart"> <title>trove restart arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: trove restart <instance> Restarts the instance. commit_message:
Fix tests/benchmark/scenarios/nova/test_utils.py

One test per method with proper mocking.

Change-Id: Ib0762d1034c71efc9751e81b75a6f2f0755d40d7
Related: blueprint unit-tests-refactoring

commit_message:
sync to latest Oslo gettextutils code level

With the goal of getting the latest i18n support integrated
we need to move to the latest gettextutils level.  This merge
implements that:

Commits included:
* 2cfc1a78 Translation Message improvements
* 0e1af5be Implementation of translation log handler
* 9d529dd3 Make Message keep string interpolation args
* ec6d9001 Add support for locales missing from babel

Additional changes were required to move wsgi and its associated test
cases from using get_localized_message() to translate().

related-bp: i18n-messages
Change-Id: Iebdf36bc11852ba4ce5bf0a543536d8de9ddbe87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/28/68728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Whitelist external lazr.authentication requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the lazr.authentication package even though it's not hosted
on PyPI. The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: I52342a805a8b0b5ade7de494b1fd9b4079b93263
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reviewday refs/changes/26/65026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv] install_command = pip install --allow-external lazr.authentication --allow-insecure lazr.authentication -U {opts} {packages}
