commit_message:
Fix of bug 1268852
As per tesmpest design, if setup method fails in particular test file,
teardown method will not be executed from the base class.

As per reported bug, if network creation is successful but vpnservice
creation failed in the setup, created network will not be get cleaned.

To resolve this issue we have two methods -
1. Use try catch in all setup methods in each test file.
2. Define a decorator in the base file and use that decorator in the
test file to make the setup failure handling generic.

Due to being global solution second method will be more effecient and
so is used here.

Fixes LP bug #1268852

Change-Id: I2dc113763c19bb7bcf263586d8dd00a242334030

commit_message:
Fix syntax error in docs

There are several syntax errors in docs.
The patch will add missing punctuation, remove extra whitespace, and
change the "heat-api-engine" to "heat-engine" in heat-engine.rst.

Change-Id: I67dcad5e0e0a1f71a67ab8fc4311d96db4820c29

commit_message:
Remove vim header

No need to set tabstop tons of times, this can be set in your vimrc
file instead.

More disucssion:
http://openstack.10931.n7.nabble.com/Remove-vim-modelines-td21780.html

Change-Id: I3b830a5bb831a63c188109e6fad66ba48884fff3

commit_message:
Fix case error in qpid exchange type "direct"

Most places correctly have "direct", but one place has "Direct"
instead, which is incorrect.

Fixes bug #1211338

(cherry picked from commit bec54ac5fb6a190c98079537f63d2f0e17584d21)

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json from tempest.common import rest_client class TroveClient(rest_client.RestClient): """ Tempest REST client for Trove V2 API. Implements the following basic Trove abstractions: resources """ def __init__(self, config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name=None): super(TroveClient, self).__init__(config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name) self.service = self.config.trove.catalog_type self.version = '1' self.uri_prefix = "v%s" % self.version def flavor_list(self): uri = '%s/flavors' % self.uri_prefix resp, body = self.get(uri) body = json.loads(body.replace("\n", "")) return resp, body

commit_message:
Some configuration options for tempest scenario

These configuration options are connected with
baremetal ops scenario. This scenario is intended
to testing baremetal provisioning. There are two
other pull requests into devstack-gate and into
tempest.

Change-Id: I77f3a6a76994251b039372a12449f2d88d3f75ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/00/64400/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Baremetal Ops Number iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_poser_name bmposer iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_poser_type qemu iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_poser_mem 512 iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_poser_ip ${TEMPEST_BMPOSER_IP:-10.250.2.20} iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_volume_name bmvol iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_network_name bmnet iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_network_bridge bmbr iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_network_ip ${TEMPEST_BM_NET_IP:-10.250.2.1} iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_network_dhcp_start ${TEMPEST_BM_DHCP_START:-10.250.2.15} iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_network_dhcp_end ${TEMPEST_BM_DHCP_END:-10.250.2.254} iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_ssh_username root # TODO(kozhukalov): generate actual ssh key pair iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario bm_ssh_key_filename /root/baremetal_id_rsa # TODO(kozhukalov): create tftp root directory iniset $TEMPEST_CONF scenario tftp_root /tftpboot

commit_message:
Get rid of duplication in metadata modification

There were 2 functions recursive_keypairs and dict_to_keyval.
To avoid confusion it was decided to use only recursive_keypairs
because it is commonly used in data manipulation.
But dict_to_keyval was used in sql implementation so that's why we need
migration.

Fixes bug: 1268618

Change-Id: I55e6f3ad40e28b5e34e056d8639bb9e6a79d105f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/80/66580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def dict_to_keyval(value, key_base=None): """Expand a given dict to its corresponding key-value pairs. Generated keys are fully qualified, delimited using dot notation. ie. key = 'key.child_key.grandchild_key[0]' """ val_iter, key_func = None, None if isinstance(value, dict): val_iter = value.iteritems() key_func = lambda k: key_base + '.' + k if key_base else k elif isinstance(value, (tuple, list)): val_iter = enumerate(value) key_func = lambda k: key_base + '[%d]' % k if val_iter: for k, v in val_iter: key_gen = key_func(k) if isinstance(v, dict) or isinstance(v, (tuple, list)): for key_gen, v in dict_to_keyval(v, key_gen): yield key_gen, v else: yield key_gen, v

commit_message:
Enable filtering list roles by name

The API docs say you can filter the roles list by name, but currently
this only works when specifying a user or group, so pass kwargs in
both requests so the global role list can be filtered by name.

Change-Id: I4b3bf28c5c050c5999256cd392531b289e1df723
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/85/65985/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_role_list_filter_by_name(self): super(RoleTests, self).test_list(name='arole')

commit_message:
Add extra resource to the compute node object

In changeset 4c21f4a82300683f55102f91ae28eca9f81c24e7, an
extra_resources column added to the DB to support extensible
resource tracker.

A corresponding field is needed in the compute node object. The
new filed is a list of object, and each of the object is a subclass
of ComputeResource, so that compute node can provide interface in
future to allocate/free/reserve/commit resources.

Implements: blueprint extensible-resource-tracking

Change-Id: I6244bdd1758c7ded86a6d3767c2d61fa76faeeaa
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix admin can't delete vm

When an admin user in one tenant creates a VM in a network belonging
to a different tenant, the code currently doesn't allow the admin to
delete the VM. This patch allows an admin user to delete the VM in
this case.

Change-Id: Ie7f73b18444ff6f0cfe3d7fc02de26eae2954d0c
Closes-bug: #1261633

commit_message:
Support timezone in memcached token backend

This patch fixes bug #1221087.

Replaces time.mktime() to calendar.timegm() in utils.unixtime()
to get correct expiration time.

After this patch, Memcached token backend does not depend on timezone.
So remove the section "Memcached and System Time" in configuration
manual.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I17233c8a79d01a37abdbd46934ad486ddc8caec9
(cherry picked from commit 1bb67a74aca9823e6d1d8335b150841adef3ee73)

commit_message:
Check image id format before executing operations

DB2 will raise 'CLI0109E String data right truncation' error if
the given query parameter is longer than the column definition.
As a result, user will run into 500 instead of 404 error though
the malformed id is not existed in DB.
This fix will add image id format checking before executing real
operations.

Closes-Bug: #1263684

Change-Id: I1ab3e38724014032d9290e7dde3f8b6d23b6df6c

commit_message:
Added resources support in pollster's interface

1. Change the pollster's interface to support resources:
- Added optional parameter 'resources' to the method get_samples. It
  specifies a list of the endpoints from which the pollster would get
  data.

2. Change the PollingTask to record the resources for each pollster.

3. Pass the resources recorded in PollingTask to the pollsters in
central agent.

This patch only changes the interface of pollsters and PollingTask in
central agent. The existing central agent's pollsters still ignore the
resources passed in by the PollingTask.

Implements: blueprint support-resources-pipeline-item
Change-Id: Ic7a83c63ea291d0527004113bc8d8bb09311d14f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/89/58489/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_samples(self, manager, cache, resources=[]): :param resources: A list of the endpoints the pollster will get data from. It's up to the specific pollster to decide how to use it. def verify_resources(self, manager, resources): """Return True if the resources is valid to this pollster, otherwise return False. :param manager: The service manager class invoking the plugin. :param resources: A list of the endpoints the pollster will get data from. It's up to the specific pollster to decide how to use it. """ return True

commit_message:
Add a new ThreadGroupManager class

Introduce a ThreadGroupManager class to manage active ThreadGroups for
engine services and move the thread-related EngineService methods to
ThreadGroupManager.  This will make it easier for multiple engine
services to manage thread groups.

Partial-Bug: #1262012
Change-Id: I1ce7785021726c274a294ef402b036540d395a29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/71/67971/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ThreadGroupManager(object): def __init__(self): super(ThreadGroupManager, self).__init__() self.groups = {} # Create dummy service task, because when there is nothing queued # on self.tg the process exits self.add_timer(cfg.CONF.periodic_interval, self._service_task) def _service_task(self): """ This is a dummy task which gets queued on the service.Service threadgroup. Without this service.Service sees nothing running i.e has nothing to wait() on, so the process exits.. This could also be used to trigger periodic non-stack-specific housekeeping tasks """ pass def start(self, stack_id, func, *args, **kwargs): """ Run the given method in a sub-thread. """ if stack_id not in self.groups: self.groups[stack_id] = threadgroup.ThreadGroup() return self.groups[stack_id].add_thread(func, *args, **kwargs) def start_with_lock(self, cnxt, stack, engine_id, func, *args, **kwargs): """ Try to acquire a stack lock and, if successful, run the given method in a sub-thread. Release the lock when the thread finishes. :param cnxt: RPC context :param stack: Stack to be operated on :type stack: heat.engine.parser.Stack :param engine_id: The UUID of the engine acquiring the lock :param func: Callable to be invoked in sub-thread :type func: function or instancemethod :param args: Args to be passed to func :param kwargs: Keyword-args to be passed to func. """ lock = stack_lock.StackLock(cnxt, stack, engine_id) lock.acquire() self.start_with_acquired_lock(stack, lock, func, *args, **kwargs) def start_with_acquired_lock(self, stack, lock, func, *args, **kwargs): """ Run the given method in a sub-thread and release the provided lock when the thread finishes. :param stack: Stack to be operated on :type stack: heat.engine.parser.Stack :param lock: The acquired stack lock :type lock: heat.engine.stack_lock.StackLock :param func: Callable to be invoked in sub-thread :type func: function or instancemethod :param args: Args to be passed to func :param kwargs: Keyword-args to be passed to func """ def release(gt, *args, **kwargs): """ Callback function that will be passed to GreenThread.link(). """ lock.release() try: th = self.start(stack.id, func, *args) th.link(release) except: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): lock.release() def add_timer(self, stack_id, func, *args, **kwargs): """ Define a periodic task, to be run in a separate thread, in the stack threadgroups. Periodicity is cfg.CONF.periodic_interval """ if stack_id not in self.groups: self.groups[stack_id] = threadgroup.ThreadGroup() self.groups[stack_id].add_timer(cfg.CONF.periodic_interval, func, *args, **kwargs) Listen on an AMQP queue named for the engine. Allows individual engines to communicate with each other for multi-engine support. def listening(self, context): self.engine_id = stack_lock.StackLock.generate_engine_id() self.thread_group_mgr = ThreadGroupManager() self.listener = EngineListener(host, self.engine_id) logger.debug(_("Starting listener for engine %s") % self.engine_id) self.thread_group_mgr.add_timer(stack_id, self._periodic_watcher_task, sid=stack_id) self.thread_group_mgr.start_with_lock(cnxt, stack, self.engine_id, _stack_create, stack) self.thread_group_mgr.start_with_lock(cnxt, current_stack, self.engine_id, current_stack.update, updated_stack) self.thread_group_mgr.start_with_lock(cnxt, stack, self.engine_id, stack.delete) self.thread_group_mgr.start_with_lock(cnxt, stack, self.engine_id, stack.delete) self.thread_group_mgr.start_with_lock(cnxt, stack, self.engine_id, _stack_suspend, stack) self.thread_group_mgr.start_with_lock(cnxt, stack, self.engine_id, _stack_resume, stack) self.thread_group_mgr.start(sid, run_alarm_action, actions, rule.get_details()) self.thread_group_mgr.start(wr.stack_id, action)
deleted_lines: Listen on an AMQP queue while a stack action is in-progress and respond to stack-related questions. Used for multi-engine support. def listening(self, ctxt): # stg == "Stack Thread Groups" self.stg = {} self.listener = EngineListener(host, stack_lock.engine_id) logger.debug(_("Starting listener for engine %s") % stack_lock.engine_id) def _start_in_thread(self, stack_id, func, *args, **kwargs): if stack_id not in self.stg: self.stg[stack_id] = threadgroup.ThreadGroup() return self.stg[stack_id].add_thread(func, *args, **kwargs) def _start_thread_with_lock(self, cnxt, stack, func, *args): """ Try to acquire a stack lock and, if successful, run the method in a sub-thread. :param cnxt: RPC context :param stack: Stack to be operated on :type stack: heat.engine.parser.Stack :param func: Callable to be invoked in sub-thread :type func: function or instancemethod :param args: Args to be passed to func """ lock = stack_lock.StackLock(cnxt, stack) def release(gt, *args, **kwargs): """ Callback function that will be passed to GreenThread.link(). """ lock.release() lock.acquire() try: th = self._start_in_thread(stack.id, func, *args) th.link(release) except: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): lock.release() def _timer_in_thread(self, stack_id, func, *args, **kwargs): """ Define a periodic task, to be run in a separate thread, in the stack threadgroups. Periodicity is cfg.CONF.periodic_interval """ if stack_id not in self.stg: self.stg[stack_id] = threadgroup.ThreadGroup() self.stg[stack_id].add_timer(cfg.CONF.periodic_interval, func, *args, **kwargs) def _service_task(self): """ This is a dummy task which gets queued on the service.Service threadgroup. Without this service.Service sees nothing running i.e has nothing to wait() on, so the process exits.. This could also be used to trigger periodic non-stack-specific housekeeping tasks """ pass self._timer_in_thread(stack_id, self._periodic_watcher_task, sid=stack_id) # Create dummy service task, because when there is nothing queued # on self.tg the process exits self.tg.add_timer(cfg.CONF.periodic_interval, self._service_task) self._start_thread_with_lock(cnxt, stack, _stack_create, stack) self._start_thread_with_lock(cnxt, current_stack, current_stack.update, updated_stack) self._start_thread_with_lock(cnxt, stack, stack.delete) self._start_thread_with_lock(cnxt, stack, stack.delete) self._start_thread_with_lock(cnxt, stack, _stack_suspend, stack) self._start_thread_with_lock(cnxt, stack, _stack_resume, stack) self._start_in_thread(sid, run_alarm_action, actions, rule.get_details()) self._start_in_thread(wr.stack_id, action)

subject: Fix 'network_name' not assinged When booting a vm with admin role and assigning it with another tenant's private network, it's fine to work. But the update info cache action will started periodically, at this time, the previous mentioned other tenant's private network is filtered out by function "get_available_network()" The exception happened since the network utilized is out. The worst affect is the vm can not be deleted normally. This patch fix it by give the variable net_ids value to function "get_available_network", so the current using network won't be out. Change-Id: I7d0d1aa5ac6c23b5f0c3913261832e062252fea0 Closes-bug: #1271405 # Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting # with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit. # On branch fix_1271405 # Changes to be committed: #   (use "git reset HEAD^1 <file>..." to unstage) # #	modified:   nova/network/neutronv2/api.py #	modified:   nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py #

Lines starting# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.# On branch fix_1271405# Changes to be committed:#   (use "git reset HEAD^1 <file>..." to unstage)##	modified:   nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#	modified:   nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py#

commit_message:
Fix 'network_name' not assingedWhen booting a vm with admin role and assigning it withanother tenant's private network, it's fine to work. Butthe update info cache action will started periodically,at this time, the previous mentioned other tenant's privatenetwork is filtered out by function "get_available_network()"The exception happened since the network utilized is out.The worst affect is the vm can not be deleted normally.This patch fix it by give the variable net_ids value to function"get_available_network", so the current using network won't beout.Change-Id: I7d0d1aa5ac6c23b5f0c3913261832e062252fea0Closes-bug: #1271405# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.# On branch fix_1271405# Changes to be committed:#   (use "git reset HEAD^1 <file>..." to unstage)##	modified:   nova/network/neutronv2/api.py#	modified:   nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py#

Change-Id: Ic983835380302daac71f101f53def3f65fa1ce10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/68559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: networks = self._get_available_networks( context, instance['project_id'], net_ids=net_ids)

subject: Correctly deal with the no-SSL case in overcloud

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 05:05:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/dbd6572fa385aa6a50283fd6212e3ea5b3440800', 'message': "Correctly deal with the no-SSL case in overcloud

Commit 1845a16 added support for SSL on the overcloud, but it does not

"}]
commit_message:
Correctly deal with the no-SSL case in overcloud

Commit 1845a16 added support for SSL on the overcloud, but it does not
correctly cope if SSL support is not specified, setting the cert file
to '.crt', which is plainly incorrect. Guard that setting with a -n.

Change-Id: I760d1917806afad67e928181f84520ed8ccf03dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/55/68555/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -n "$SSLBASE" ]; then OVERCLOUD_SSL_CERT=$(<$SSLBASE.crt) OVERCLOUD_SSL_KEY=$(<$SSLBASE.key) else OVERCLOUD_SSL_CERT='' OVERCLOUD_SSL_KEY='' fi

commit_message:
Sync OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE with keystone

For now, keystone default role is _member_, while horizon set
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE to Member. It will really be user
friendly to modify horizon default value to _member_ to sync with
keystone's default setting.

Change-Id: I55d15e6cfb74e52e933c5a44efd6c27930415738
Closes-Bug: #1264228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/37/64137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE = "_member_"

commit_message:
use six.move.xrange replace xrange

in python3.x, there is no method named xrange(),
it has replaced by range(),which is equal to xrange()
in python2.x. so we must fix this issue.
we use six moduleto fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1268439
Change-Id: I7aa8fe80155710cd639721d4b3d5bd9b4219e27d

commit_message:
Add new rate-based disk and network pipelines

Addresses: BP rates-derived-from-cumulative

Add new pipeline config to derive rate-based gauge meters
from the current set of cumulative disk and network meters
gathered by the compute agent.

The latter form of meter is not suitable for alarming
against a static threshold, whereas rate-based meters would
allow for example autoscaling actions to be driven off the
observed per-second rates of I/O.

Change-Id: I5764797d4eebb129b66a1524d47c38282c6ef095

commit_message:
assertTrue(isinstance) replace by assertIsInstance

some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Change-Id: I7072fef7fe5f76e526fc0ccca7a4894accaae80f
Closes-Bug: #1268480

commit_message:
replace assertTrue(isinstance) to assertIsInstance

some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by testtools

Change-Id: Idd931d27b13a46800e27393a98da096d41442320
Closes-bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Insertion in HBase should be fixed

* All data inserted to HBase should be String or Unicode
* Data stored in HBase is flatten

Fixes bug 1240474

Change-Id: Ic36f5460275de3c829a7b27932bde284d71bd806

commit_message:
Remove copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Change-Id: I357adea1d295cdc11a12194ad7116d73a8560122
Closes-Bug: #1262424

commit_message:
Pull Bug #1263122 fix for service module from Oslo

Get latest service module from Oslo mainly to avoid the impact of
bug #1263122 when multi-process API service is enabled.

Follow commits are included in this change:
* 8b2b0b7 2013-12-20 | Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
* 37e46bb 2013-12-20 | disable SIGHUP restart behavior in foreground
* 12bcdb7 2013-10-11 | Remove vim header

Change-Id: I506ff809c32542520cc6ba2fa07519b1361f439c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/42/64642/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # Importing just the symbol here because the io module does not # exist in Python 2.6. from io import UnsupportedOperation # noqa except ImportError: # Python 2.6 UnsupportedOperation = None from cinder.openstack.common.gettextutils import _def _is_daemon(): # The process group for a foreground process will match the # process group of the controlling terminal. If those values do # not match, or ioctl() fails on the stdout file handle, we assume # the process is running in the background as a daemon. # http://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/bashref.html#Job-Control-Basics try: is_daemon = os.getpgrp() != os.tcgetpgrp(sys.stdout.fileno()) except OSError as err: if err.errno == errno.ENOTTY: # Assume we are a daemon because there is no terminal. is_daemon = True else: raise except UnsupportedOperation: # Could not get the fileno for stdout, so we must be a daemon. is_daemon = True return is_daemon def _is_sighup_and_daemon(signo): if not (_sighup_supported() and signo == signal.SIGHUP): # Avoid checking if we are a daemon, because the signal isn't # SIGHUP. return False return _is_daemon() if not _is_sighup_and_daemon(signo): if not _is_sighup_and_daemon(signo): if not _is_sighup_and_daemon(self.sigcaught):
deleted_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 from cinder.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqadef _is_sighup(signo): return _sighup_supported() and signo == signal.SIGHUP if not _is_sighup(signo): if not _is_sighup(signo): if not _is_sighup(self.sigcaught):

commit_message:
Update README.rst with details about unit tests

This commit just fixes a couple of issues with the README file and adds
some details about the OS_TEST_PATH env variable and unit tests.

Closes-bug: #1268440

Change-Id: I17f75f7d7b3a2ac75eac884bc403bc46d6a2e77f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/96/66396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $> testr run --parallelAlternatively, you can use the run_tempest.sh script which will create a venv Unit Tests ---------- Tempest also has a set of unit tests which test the tempest code itself. These tests can be run by specifing the test discovery path:: $> OS_TEST_PATH=./tempest/tests testr run --parallel By setting OS_TEST_PATH to ./tempest/tests it specifies that test discover should only be run on the unit test directory. The default value of OS_TEST_PATH is OS_TEST_PATH=./tempest/test_discover which will only run test discover on the tempest suite. Alternatively, you can use the run_tests.sh script which will create a venv and run the unit tests. There are also the py26, py27, or py33 tox jobs which will run the unit tests with the corresponding version of python.
deleted_lines: $> testr run --parallel tempestAlternatively, you can use the run_tests.sh script which will create a venv

commit_message:
Add volume extend functionality support

Cinder now has the ablity to extend a volume, This functionality
should be exposed through Horizon.

Change-Id: Iff26453fd0a83af97fad4adabbcd53f646a15e51
Implements: blueprint volume-extend

added_lines: class ExtendForm(forms.SelfHandlingForm): id = forms.CharField(widget=forms.HiddenInput()) name = forms.CharField(label=_("Volume Name"), widget=forms.TextInput( attrs={'readonly': 'readonly'} )) orig_size = forms.IntegerField(widget=forms.HiddenInput()) new_size = forms.IntegerField(min_value=1, label=_("Size (GB)")) def clean(self): cleaned_data = super(ExtendForm, self).clean() new_size = cleaned_data.get('new_size', 1) if new_size <= cleaned_data['orig_size']: raise ValidationError( _("New size for extend must be greater than current size.")) return cleaned_data def handle(self, request, data): try: volume = cinder.volume_extend(request, data['id'], data['new_size']) message = _('Successfully extended volume: "%s"') % data['name'] messages.success(request, message) return volume except Exception: redirect = reverse("horizon:project:volumes:index") exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to extend volume.'), redirect=redirect)

commit_message:
Fix logic for "nova flavor-show 0#"

For perviously logic, if flavor id is
start with "0Number", int(name_or_id)
will convert it to "Number". If flavor
id "Number" exist in DB, it will show
up for query with "0Number".
This fix enter flavor search logic at
the beginning. Also add one more UT
for this function.

Change-Id: Ic48ff4275978404064c0c6fce6f98181660aa84a
Fixes: bug 1268456

commit_message:
cinder v2 api tests - fix volume client

This is a legacy problem in change
I712a90d39981564af09393ed1b7f4be12897c808

1. move cls.volumes_client, cls.volumes_extension_client
   cls.snapshots_client from BaseVolumeTest into
   subclass(BaseVolumeV1Test)
2. delete call cls.volumes_client.keystone_auth as it is
   called automatically in request method of RestClient.

Change-Id: I5184de9911e3fe9a3c23c2c4f84e59596f10b77c
Implements: blueprint cinder-v2-api-tests

Some subclasses of SignalResponder may assign a resource_id
with the real reasource that it creates.

With this change, the user_id is always stored in resource data.
If user_id resource data is missing an assumption is made that
this resource was created before this commit, so the

commit_message:
Allow choice in how SignalResponder user id is stored.

Some subclasses of SignalResponder may assign a resource_id
with the real reasource that it creates.

With this change, the user_id is always stored in resource data.
If user_id resource data is missing an assumption is made that
this resource was created before this commit, so the
resource_id is used as the user_id.

Subclasses of SignalResponder which previously used the
user ID as their resource_id now need to call resource_id_set
themselves during handle_create.

Change-Id: Iac41ab99f8e9b0953b2cd447ff0e027443fabeca

commit_message:
Instance details view shows hostname (if it has it) or IP

Currently the hostname and IP is controlled by two config values:
trove_dns_support and add_addresses. I dont see a point of having
the hostname and IP indenpendent. It causes issues for old instances
when DNS is enabled.

I propose to simplify the view by showing hostname if it is set or
show the IP if it is not set.

Closes-bug: #1260567

Change-Id: Ia1fd47cbee89b10d53b0821e104a34eb31543846

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue with explicit assertIsInstance

assertIsInstance can provide useful message when test fails,
this patch replaces assertTrue(isinstance(x, y)) with
assertIsInstance(x, y).

Change-Id: I1a36b4f343c881b6690389753270d35599b758ab
Closes-Bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Rewrite pieces of code deprecated by Django 1.7

The mimtype argument of HttpResponse, SimpleTemplateResponse,
TemplateResponse, and render_to_response was removed; one should
use content_type instead

Change-Id: I62214c37264845dbabf006a32616e894c4ac9e3a
Closes-bug: #1266676
Partially-impelements: blueprint django-1point6

commit_message:
Fixing typo "existant". Must be "existent"

Negative tests that use the word "existant" are being corrected to "existent".
The current framework has random usage of the word 'existant' instead of
'existent'.

Change-Id: I4219c372befbd8235757f124d1414317d9b01f72

commit_message:
More network debugging detail

* devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh: Sometimes devstack-gate runs fail for
reasons related to the local network. Include IPv6 addresses in
addition to the IPv4 addressing previously displayed, and add
routing and ARP tables as well.

Change-Id: I771b6081758020cf1521443d1bd15a27ede7f2b1

commit_message:
Copy run_test.sh from heat repo

This allows run_test.sh to run without a working venv, plus all the
other features of heat/run_test.sh

Change-Id: I71d7af8a5442626192c5c8b5dca446a999ff6ede
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/58/66258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BASE_DIR=`dirname $0` function usage { echo "Usage: $0 [OPTION]..." echo "Run heatclient test suite(s)" echo "" echo " -V, --virtual-env Use virtualenv. Install automatically if not present." echo " (Default is to run tests in local environment)" echo " -F, --force Force a clean re-build of the virtual environment. Useful when dependencies have been added." echo " -f, --func Functional tests have been removed." echo " -u, --unit Run unit tests (default when nothing specified)" echo " -p, --pep8 Run pep8 tests" echo " --all Run pep8 and unit tests" echo " -c, --coverage Generate coverage report" echo " -d, --debug Run tests with testtools instead of testr. This allows you to use the debugger." echo " -h, --help Print this usage message" exit } # must not assign -a as an option, needed for selecting custom attributes no_venv=1 function process_option { case "$1" in -V|--virtual-env) no_venv=0;; -F|--force) force=1;; -f|--func) test_func=1;; -u|--unit) test_unit=1;; -p|--pep8) test_pep8=1;; --all) test_unit=1; test_pep8=1;; -c|--coverage) coverage=1;; -d|--debug) debug=1;; -h|--help) usage;; *) args="$args $1"; test_unit=1;; esac } venv=.venv with_venv=tools/with_venv.sh wrapper="" debug=0 function run_tests { echo 'Running tests' if [ $debug -eq 1 ]; then echo "Debugging..." if [ "$args" = "" ]; then # Default to running all tests if specific test is not # provided. testrargs="discover ./heatclient/tests" fi ${wrapper} python -m testtools.run $args $testrargs # Short circuit because all of the testr and coverage stuff # below does not make sense when running testtools.run for # debugging purposes. return $? fi # Just run the test suites in current environment if [ -n "$args" ] ; then args="-t $args" fi ${wrapper} python setup.py testr --slowest $args } function run_pep8 { echo "Running flake8..." bash -c "${wrapper} flake8" } # run unit tests with pep8 when no arguments are specified # otherwise process CLI options if [[ $# == 0 ]]; then test_pep8=1 test_unit=1 else for arg in "$@"; do process_option $arg doneif [ "$no_venv" == 0 ] then # Remove the virtual environment if --force used if [ "$force" == 1 ]; then echo "Cleaning virtualenv..." rm -rf ${venv} fi if [ -e ${venv} ]; then wrapper="${with_venv}" else # Automatically install the virtualenv python tools/install_venv.py wrapper="${with_venv}" firesult=0 # If functional or unit tests have been selected, run them if [ "$test_unit" == 1 ] || [ "$debug" == 1 ] ; then run_tests result=$? # Run pep8 if it was selected if [ "$test_pep8" == 1 ]; then run_pep8 fi # Generate coverage report if [ "$coverage" == 1 ]; then echo "Generating coverage report in ./cover" ${wrapper} python setup.py testr --coverage --slowest ${wrapper} python -m coverage report --show-missing fi exit $result
deleted_lines: function usage { echo "Usage: $0 [OPTION]..." echo "Run python-heatclient's test suite(s)" echo "" echo " -p, --pep8 Just run pep8" echo " -h, --help Print this usage message" echo "" echo "This script is deprecated and currently retained for compatibility." echo 'You can run the full test suite for multiple environments by running "tox".' echo 'You can run tests for only python 2.7 by running "tox -e py27", or run only' echo 'the pep8 tests with "tox -e pep8".' exit } command -v tox > /dev/null 2>&1 if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo 'This script requires "tox" to run.' echo 'You can install it with "pip install tox".' exit 1; fi just_pep8=0 function process_option { case "$1" in -h|--help) usage;; -p|--pep8) let just_pep8=1;; esac } for arg in "$@"; do process_option $arg done if [ $just_pep8 -eq 1 ]; then exec tox -e pep8tox -e py27 $toxargs 2>&1 | tee run_tests.err.log || exit 1 tox_exit_code=${PIPESTATUS[0]} if [ 0$tox_exit_code -ne 0 ]; then exit $tox_exit_codeif [ -z "$toxargs" ]; then tox -e pep8

commit_message:
PXE instance_name is no longer mandatory

With the use of node.uuid as the property to build the directory
name for the instance images, instance_name is not longer needed
to validate the pxe driver info.

commit_message:
Remove custom install_command for argparse

Installing argparse now works with pip 1.5 without the need
for externa/unverified flags.

Change-Id: I57a62b1703f71149a305a4cb9d74367a642360b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/26/68526/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Required for pip 1.5 | Temporally overriding for netaddr - GitHub #392 #install_command = pip install --allow-external netaddr --allow-unverified netaddr {opts} {packages}

subject: Enable tag-based full version reporting via pbr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 23:10:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/95326ee7ff72c8862545843ee74c9c77cf5f9ec0', 'message': "Enable tag-based full version reporting via pbr

The setup.cfg file had a fixed version specified, which the version resource
was pulling (via pbr) to display as the build version. By removing this, pbr
not reports the latest tag's version. The barbican/version.py __version__
was also modified to be set to the fill tag version rather than a shortened
version as before.

Change-Id: Id312d5c92b18143e77e6d8917248674c6ed76bc8
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-23 00:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/version.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/9d9183f1bcae72a48bf7a9a90716f86fbee4eb84', 'message': 'Enable tag-based full version reporting via pbr

Modified barbican/version.py to set __version__ to the full version rather
than a shortened version as before.

Change-Id: Id312d5c92b18143e77e6d8917248674c6ed76bc8
'}]
commit_message:
Enable tag-based full version reporting via pbr

Modified barbican/version.py to set __version__ to the full version rather
than a shortened version as before.

Change-Id: Id312d5c92b18143e77e6d8917248674c6ed76bc8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/17/68517/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Drop version requirement for argparse
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 23:42:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient/commit/c5a58b4c17f52d5657e4b620af0e6821cb9ac0c9', 'message': 'Add tox install command for pip 1.5

Installing dependencies with pip 1.5 will fail on argparse unless

Change-Id: I61658ad8a40bb5caff095ddd698e65962ab3c1b2
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-23 00:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient/commit/45ffca9951e3c53b3495eaf06a89fe609b057a77', 'message': 'Drop version requirement for argparse

argparse 1.2.1 is not verified in PyPI, which causes pip 1.5 to
fail when installing the dependencies.

Change-Id: I61658ad8a40bb5caff095ddd698e65962ab3c1b2
'}]
commit_message:
Drop version requirement for argparse

argparse 1.2.1 is not verified in PyPI, which causes pip 1.5 to
fail when installing the dependencies.

Change-Id: I61658ad8a40bb5caff095ddd698e65962ab3c1b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient refs/changes/22/68522/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Required for pip 1.5 #install_command = pip install --allow-unverified argparse {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Add tool to document cli tools

Call "os_doc_tools/commands.py" nova to generate a file
section_cli_nova_commands.xml with the command line options.

Allows generation of all supported clients with --all command.
The tool gets installed as: openstack-auto-commands

blueprint os-user-doc
Change-Id: Ie4b200818bd585d3fce0b27f0639ad03069b3b7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/28/68228/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
#!/usr/bin/env python # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import argparse import subprocess import sys # NOTE(berendt): check_output as provided in Python 2.7.5 to make script # usable with Python < 2.7 def check_output(*popenargs, **kwargs): """Run command with arguments and return its output as a byte string. If the exit code was non-zero it raises a CalledProcessError. The CalledProcessError object will have the return code in the returncode attribute and output in the output attribute. """ if 'stdout' in kwargs: raise ValueError('stdout argument not allowed, it will be overridden.') process = subprocess.Popen(stdout=subprocess.PIPE, *popenargs, **kwargs) output, unused_err = process.communicate() retcode = process.poll() if retcode: cmd = kwargs.get("args") if cmd is None: cmd = popenargs[0] raise subprocess.CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd, output=output) return output def quote_xml(line): """Convert special characters for XML output.""" return line.replace('&', '&').replace('<', '<') def generate_heading(os_command, os_file): """Convert os_command --help to DocBook.""" print("Documenting %s help" % os_command) help_lines = check_output([os_command, "--help"]).split('
') if os_command == 'nova': api_name = "Compute API" header = """<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <section xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:id="{0}client_commands"> <title>{0} commands</title> <para>The {0} client is the command-line interface for the {1} and its extensions.</para> <para>For help on a specific <command>{0}</command> command, enter: </para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput><command>{0}</command> \ <option>help</option> <replaceable>COMMAND</replaceable></userinput></screen> <example> <title>{0} usage</title>""" os_file.write(header.format(os_command, api_name)) ignore_next_lines = False next_line_screen = True for line in help_lines: xline = quote_xml(line) if len(line) > 0 and line[0] != ' ': if '<subcommand>' in line: ignore_next_lines = False continue if 'Positional arguments' in line: ignore_next_lines = False next_line_screen = True continue if 'Optional arguments' in line: os_file.write("</computeroutput></screen>
") os_file.write(" </example>
") os_file.write(" <example>
") os_file.write(" <title>%s optional arguments</title>
" % os_command) next_line_screen = True ignore_next_lines = False continue continue if '<subcommand> ...' in line: os_file.write("%s</computeroutput></screen>
" % xline) os_file.write(" </example>
") os_file.write(" <example>
") os_file.write(" <title>%s positional arguments</title>
" % os_command) ignore_next_lines = True continue if not ignore_next_lines: if next_line_screen: os_file.write(" <screen><computeroutput>%s
" % xline) next_line_screen = False elif len(line) > 0: os_file.write("%s
" % (xline)) os_file.write("</computeroutput></screen>
") os_file.write(" </example>
") def generate_subcommand(os_command, os_subcommand, os_file): """Convert os_command help os_subcommand to DocBook.""" help_lines = check_output([os_command, "help", os_subcommand]).split('
') os_file.write(" <example>
") os_file.write(" <title>%s %s arguments</title>
" % (os_command, os_subcommand)) next_line_screen = True for line in help_lines: xline = quote_xml(line) if next_line_screen: os_file.write(" <screen><computeroutput>%s
" % xline) next_line_screen = False elif len(line) > 0: os_file.write("%s
" % (xline)) os_file.write("</computeroutput></screen>
") os_file.write(" </example>
") def generate_subcommands(os_command, os_file): """Convert os_command help subcommands for all subcommands to DocBook.""" print("Documenting %s subcommands..." % os_command) all_options = check_output([os_command, "bash-completion"]).strip().split() subcommands = [o for o in all_options if not (o.startswith('-') or o == "help")] for subcommand in sorted(subcommands): print(" %s" % subcommand) generate_subcommand(os_command, subcommand, os_file) print ("%d subcommands documented." % len(subcommands)) def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Generate DocBook XML files " "to document python-PROJECTclients") parser.add_argument('client', nargs='?', default="nova", help="OpenStack command to document") prog_args = parser.parse_args() print ("Documenting '%s'" % prog_args.client) os_file = open("section_cli_" + prog_args.client + "_commands.xml", 'w') generate_heading(prog_args.client, os_file) generate_subcommands(prog_args.client, os_file) os_file.write("</section>
") os_file.close() if __name__ == "__main__": sys.exit(main())

commit_message:
import CONF.fake_network in linux_net

CONF.fake_network is used in nova.network.linux_net but wasn't imported.
Because CONF is a global object this bug was hidden when
CONF.fake_network was imported elsewhere. This bug was only seen when
running nova-api-metadata which we don't test in the gate.

Change-Id: I33db193c64be5f100dc376cb8b2baeac8390442c
Closes-Bug: #1270845

commit_message:
Remove references to '24 hour' tokens

The token lifespan used by a deployment is configurable via
`keystone.conf [token] expiration` - it may not be 24 hours.

In fact, bp reduce-default-token-duration recently reduced the default
token duration from 24 hours to just one hour. The keystone community
expects to tweak this value over the next several releases, so I've
avoided using a specific value here to reduce maintenance effort.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/reduce-default-token-duration

Change-Id: I86afd624c2d8ef4de3275ebaf3ceab80ef324f3e

commit_message:
Autogenerate python cli page

Use new tool to autogenerate cli pages.

Pages are created using current client git versions.

Note that swift output looks a bit different
since swift does not support "swift help subcommand".

Change-Id: I1b44e188ea460c9ece973cd52443f5533f93e8b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/27/68227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>For help on a specific <command>nova</command> command, enter: </para> <title>nova usage</title> <screen><computeroutput> [--timeout <seconds>] [--os-username <auth-user-name>] [--os-password <auth-password>] [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>] [--os-tenant-id <auth-tenant-id>] [--os-auth-url <auth-url>] [--os-region-name <region-name>] [--os-auth-system <auth-system>] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--volume-service-name <volume-service-name>] [--endpoint-type <endpoint-type>] [--os-compute-api-version <compute-api-ver>] [--os-cacert <ca-certificate>] [--insecure] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] <subcommand> ...</computeroutput></screen> <title>nova positional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> <subcommand> absolute-limits Print a list of absolute limits for a user agent-create Create new agent build. agent-delete Delete existing agent build. agent-modify Modify existing agent build. aggregate-delete Delete the aggregate. coverage-report Generate coverage report. credentials Show user credentials returned from auth. fixed-ip-get Retrieve info on a fixed ip. fixed-ip-reserve Reserve a fixed IP. fixed-ip-unreserve Unreserve a fixed IP. flavor-create Create a new flavor Bulk create floating ips by range. Bulk delete floating ips by range. List all floating ips. keypair-delete Delete keypair given by its name. keypair-list Print a list of keypairs for a user keypair-show Show details about the given keypair. live-migration Migrate running instance to a new machine. quota-delete Delete quota for a tenant/user so their quota will Revert back to default. quota-show List the quotas for a tenant/user. quota-update Update the quotas for a tenant/user. rate-limits Print a list of rate limits for a user scrub Delete data associated with the project. usage Show usage data for a single tenant. usage-list List usage data for all tenants. volume-type-delete Delete a specific flavor x509-get-root-cert Fetch the x509 root cert. bash-completion Prints all of the commands and options to stdout so that the nova.bash_completion script doesn't have to hard code them. host-servers-migrate Migrate all instances of the specified host to other available hosts. instance-action Show an action. instance-action-list List actions on a server. list-extensions List all the os-api extensions that are available. host-meta Set or Delete metadata on all instances of a host. host-evacuate Evacuate all instances from failed host to specified one. migration-list Print a list of migrations. cell-capacities Get cell capacities for all cells or a given cell. cell-show Show details of a given cell. Print list of available baremetal nodes.</computeroutput></screen> <title>nova optional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> --version show program's version number and exit --debug Print debugging output --timings Print call timing info --timeout <seconds> Set HTTP call timeout (in seconds) Defaults to compute for most actions Defaults to env[NOVA_SERVICE_NAME] Defaults to env[NOVA_VOLUME_SERVICE_NAME] Accepts 1.1 or 3, defaults to env[OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION]. Use this API endpoint instead of the Service Catalog </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova absolute-limits arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova absolute-limits [--tenant [<tenant>]] [--reserved] Print a list of absolute limits for a user Optional arguments: --tenant [<tenant>] Display information from single tenant (Admin only). --reserved Include reservations count. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova add-fixed-ip arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova add-fixed-ip <server> <network-id> Add new IP address on a network to server. Positional arguments: <server> Name or ID of server. <network-id> Network ID. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova add-floating-ip arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova add-floating-ip [--fixed-address <fixed_address>] <server> <address> Add a floating IP address to a server. Positional arguments: <server> Name or ID of server. <address> IP Address. Optional arguments: --fixed-address <fixed_address> Fixed IP Address to associate with. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova add-secgroup arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova add-secgroup <server> <secgroup> Add a Security Group to a server. Positional arguments: <node> ID of node </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova boot arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova boot [--flavor <flavor>] [--image <image>] [--image-with <key=value>] [--boot-volume <volume_id>] [--snapshot <snapshot_id>] [--num-instances <number>] [--meta <key=value>] [--file <dst-path=src-path>] [--key-name <key-name>] [--user-data <user-data>] [--availability-zone <availability-zone>] [--security-groups <security-groups>] [--block-device-mapping <dev-name=mapping>] [--block-device key1=value1[,key2=value2...]] [--swap <swap_size>] [--ephemeral size=<size>[,format=<format>]] [--hint <key=value>] [--nic <net-id=net-uuid,v4-fixed-ip=ip-addr,port-id=port-uuid>] [--config-drive <value>] [--poll] <name> Boot a new server. Positional arguments: <name> Name for the new server Optional arguments: --flavor <flavor> Name or ID of flavor (see 'nova flavor-list'). --image <image> Name or ID of image (see 'nova image-list'). --image-with <key=value> Image metadata property (see 'nova image-show'). --boot-volume <volume_id> Volume ID to boot from. --snapshot <snapshot_id> Sapshot ID to boot from (will create a volume). --num-instances <number> boot multi instances at a time (limited by quota). --meta <key=value> Record arbitrary key/value metadata to /meta.js on the new server. Can be specified multiple times. --file <dst-path=src-path> Store arbitrary files from <src-path> locally to <dst- path> on the new server. You may store up to 5 files. --key-name <key-name> Key name of keypair that should be created earlier with the command keypair-add --user-data <user-data> user data file to pass to be exposed by the metadata server. --availability-zone <availability-zone> The availability zone for instance placement. --security-groups <security-groups> Comma separated list of security group names. --block-device-mapping <dev-name=mapping> Block device mapping in the format <dev- name>=<id>:<type>:<size(GB)>:<delete-on-terminate>. --block-device key1=value1[,key2=value2...] Block device mapping with the keys: id=image_id, snapshot_id or volume_id, source=source type (image, snapshot, volume or blank), dest=destination type of the block device (volume or local), bus=device's bus, device=name of the device (e.g. vda, xda, ...), size=size of the block device in GB, format=device will be formatted (e.g. swap, ext3, ntfs, ...), bootindex=integer used for ordering the boot disks, type=device type (e.g. disk, cdrom, ...) and shutdown=shutdown behaviour (either preserve or remove). --swap <swap_size> Create and attach a local swap block device of <swap_size> MB. --ephemeral size=<size>[,format=<format>] Create and attach a local ephemeral block device of <size> GB and format it to <format>. --hint <key=value> Send arbitrary key/value pairs to the scheduler for custom use. --nic <net-id=net-uuid,v4-fixed-ip=ip-addr,port-id=port-uuid> Create a NIC on the server. Specify option multiple times to create multiple NICs. net-id: attach NIC to network with this UUID (required if no port-id), v4 -fixed-ip: IPv4 fixed address for NIC (optional), port-id: attach NIC to port with this UUID (required if no net-id) --config-drive <value> Enable config drive --poll Blocks while instance builds so progress can be reported. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova cell-capacities arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova cell-capacities [--cell <cell-name>] Get cell capacities for all cells or a given cell. Positional arguments: <volume> Name or ID of the volume. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-snapshot-create arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-snapshot-create [--force <True|False>] [--display-name <display-name>] [--display-description <display-description>] <volume-id> Add a new snapshot. Positional arguments: <volume-id> ID of the volume to snapshot Optional arguments: --force <True|False> Optional flag to indicate whether to snapshot a volume even if its attached to an instance. (Default=False) --display-name <display-name> Optional snapshot name. (Default=None) --display-description <display-description> Optional snapshot description. (Default=None) </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-snapshot-delete arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-snapshot-delete <snapshot> Remove a snapshot. Positional arguments: <snapshot> Name or ID of the snapshot to delete. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-snapshot-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-snapshot-list List all the snapshots. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-snapshot-show arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-snapshot-show <snapshot> Show details about a snapshot. Positional arguments: <snapshot> Name or ID of the snapshot. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-type-create arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-type-create <name> Create a new volume type. Positional arguments: <name> Name of the new flavor </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-type-delete arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-type-delete <id> Delete a specific flavor Positional arguments: <id> Unique ID of the volume type to delete </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-type-list arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-type-list Print a list of available 'volume types'. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova volume-update arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova volume-update <server> <volume> <volume> Update volume attachment. Positional arguments: <server> Name or ID of server. <volume> Attachment ID of the volume. <volume> ID of the volume to attach. </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova x509-create-cert arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova x509-create-cert [<private-key-filename>] [<x509-cert-filename>] Create x509 cert for a user in tenant. Positional arguments: <private-key-filename> Filename for the private key [Default: pk.pem] <x509-cert-filename> Filename for the X.509 certificate [Default: cert.pem] </computeroutput></screen> </example> <example> <title>nova x509-get-root-cert arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput>usage: nova x509-get-root-cert [<filename>] Fetch the x509 root cert. deleted_lines: <para>For help on a specific nova command, enter:</para> <title>Usage</title> <screen><computeroutput>nova [--version] [--debug] [--os-cache] [--timings] [--timeout <seconds>] [--os-username <auth-user-name>] [--os-password <auth-password>] [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>] [--os-tenant-id <auth-tenant-id>] [--os-auth-url <auth-url>] [--os-region-name <region-name>] [--os-auth-system <auth-system>] [--service-type <service-type>] [--service-name <service-name>] [--volume-service-name <volume-service-name>] [--endpoint-type <endpoint-type>] [--os-compute-api-version <compute-api-ver>] [--os-cacert <ca-certificate>] [--insecure] [--bypass-url <bypass-url>] <subcommand> ...</computeroutput></screen> <title>Positional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput><subcommand> absolute-limits Print a list of absolute limits for a user. agent-create Creates a new agent build. agent-delete Deletes an existing agent build. agent-modify Modify an existing agent build. aggregate-delete Delete the aggregate by its id. coverage-report Generate a coverage report. credentials Show user credentials returned from auth fixed-ip-get Get info on a fixed ip. fixed-ip-reserve Reserve a fixed ip. fixed-ip-unreserve Unreserve a fixed ip. flavor-create Create a new flavor. Bulk create floating ips by range Bulk delete floating ips by range List all floating ips keypair-delete Delete keypair by its name. keypair-list Print a list of keypairs for a user. live-migration Migrates a running instance to a new machine. quota-delete Delete quota for a tenant so their quota will revert back to default. quota-show List the quotas for a tenant. quota-update Update the quotas for a tenant. rate-limits Print a list of rate limits for a user. scrub Deletes data associated with the project. usage Show usage data for a single tenant usage-list List usage data for all tenants volume-type-delete Delete a specific flavor. x509-get-root-cert Fetches the x509 root cert. bash-completion Prints out a list of all possible commands and flags that the nova command can accept. Can be used by bash for tab-completion of commands. cell-capacities Get cell capacities for all cells or a given cell. cell-show Show details of a given cell. host-servers-migrate Migrate all instances of the specified host to other available hosts. Print a list of available baremetal nodes. migration-list Print a list of migrations. host-meta Set or Delete metadata on all instances of a host. host-evacuate Evacuate all instances from failed host to specified one. instance-action Show an action. instance-action-list List actions on a server. list-extensions List all the os-api extensions that are available. instance-action Show an action. instance-action-list List actions on a server.</computeroutput></screen> <title>Optional arguments</title> <screen><computeroutput> --version Show program's version number and exit. --debug Print debugging output. --force Force quota-update. --timings Print call timing info. --timeout <seconds> Set HTTP call timeout (in seconds). Defaults to compute for most actions. Defaults to env[NOVA_SERVICE_NAME]. Defaults to env[NOVA_VOLUME_SERVICE_NAME]. Accepts 1.1, defaults to env[OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION]. Use this API endpoint instead of the Service Catalog.</computeroutput></screen>

subject: Move console output log place in test_cross_tenant_connectivity

commit_message:
Move console output log place in test_cross_tenant_connectivity

Previous place missed to log when we fail to
verify mac address in the VM.

Change-Id: I58b68cbfdee8780fd213ec6b651c5374d5430045
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/80/67480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: for tenant_id in self.tenants.keys(): self._deploy_tenant(tenant_id) self._verify_network_details(self.tenants[tenant_id]) self._verify_mac_addr(self.tenants[tenant_id]) # in-tenant check self._test_in_tenant_block(self.demo_tenant) self._test_in_tenant_allow(self.demo_tenant) # cross tenant check source_tenant = self.demo_tenant dest_tenant = self.alt_tenant self._test_cross_tenant_block(source_tenant, dest_tenant) self._test_cross_tenant_allow(source_tenant, dest_tenant) except Exception: self._log_console_output(servers=self.servers) raise
deleted_lines: self._log_console_output(servers=self.servers) for tenant_id in self.tenants.keys(): self._deploy_tenant(tenant_id) self._verify_network_details(self.tenants[tenant_id]) self._verify_mac_addr(self.tenants[tenant_id]) # in-tenant check self._test_in_tenant_block(self.demo_tenant) self._test_in_tenant_allow(self.demo_tenant) # cross tenant check source_tenant = self.demo_tenant dest_tenant = self.alt_tenant self._test_cross_tenant_block(source_tenant, dest_tenant) self._test_cross_tenant_allow(source_tenant, dest_tenant)

Revert "JSHint integration"

This reverts commit 7711a78ac4365a04d49a69ca5238b7c2fc045f15.

subject: Update transifex config file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 21:12:35.000000000', 'files': ['.tx/config'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/4bf9ca0242cd7b384f0b80dcbacab5845cf19647', 'message': 'Update transifex config file

The propose-translation-update job currently fails
because of these needed changes to .tx/config

With this patch, the translation jobs should start working

Change-Id: I2ea193104c225567354d434d7a3049b87c34d621
'}]
commit_message:
Update transifex config file

The propose-translation-update job currently fails
because of these needed changes to .tx/config

With this patch, the translation jobs should start working
again.

Change-Id: I2ea193104c225567354d434d7a3049b87c34d621
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/82/68482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: type = POtype = POtype = POtype = POtype = POtype = POtype = POtype = POtype = PO [openstack-manuals-i18n.glossary] file_filter = doc/glossary/locale/<lang>.po source_file = doc/glossary/locale/glossary.pot source_lang = en type = PO [openstack-manuals-i18n.training-guides] file_filter = doc/training-guides/locale/<lang>.po source_file = doc/training-guides/locale/training-guides.pot source_lang = en type = PO

subject: Remove missed reference to a federation mapping's "name"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 20:03:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3-os-federation-ext.md'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api/commit/96da9c1fb410a4221e535408c17f35d5fbf35874', 'message': 'Remove missed reference to a federation mapping's "name"

Mapping names were replaced by user-defined IDs.

Change-Id: I2d4b34c02dbf3bc86bf3a95a600c7f3da64f9b21
'}]
commit_message:
Remove missed reference to a federation mapping's "name"

Mapping names were replaced by user-defined IDs.

Change-Id: I2d4b34c02dbf3bc86bf3a95a600c7f3da64f9b21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/26/68226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: API objects. An Identity Provider can have a single `mapping` specified per protocol. A mapping is simply a list of `rules`. The only Identity API objects
deleted_lines: API objects. An Identity Provider can have a single `mapping` specified. A mapping has a `name` and a list of `rules`. The only Identity API objects

commit_message:
Setup ccache symlinks on openSUSE

openSUSE's ccache package doesn't include symlinks to enable ccache
for gcc by default, so we set them up manually.

Change-Id: I79dbe814ff2dfad8158fb1f06d68cc07eae19a41

subject: Enable driver methods without explicit 'task' arg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-22 19:14:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/task_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/541c691db355f550541ae8bf6219418b4cf36f07', 'message': "Enable driver methods without explicit 'task' arg

Enable calling driver methods (eg, set_power_state) without explicitly
passing a TaskManager instance as an arg to the method. Because many
driver methods are decorated with task_manager.require_exclusive_lock,
this decorator must now be able to pull the relevant TaskManager
instance from the calling scope.

Change-Id: I74027d129fc6ecea9712beba3037cca008cc4c0e
Related-bug: 1259346
"}]
commit_message:
Enable driver methods without explicit 'task' arg

Enable calling driver methods (eg, set_power_state) without explicitly
passing a TaskManager instance as an arg to the method. Because many
driver methods are decorated with task_manager.require_exclusive_lock,
this decorator must now be able to pull the relevant TaskManager
instance from the calling scope.

Change-Id: I74027d129fc6ecea9712beba3037cca008cc4c0e
Related-bug: 1259346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/63/68463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import inspect if isinstance(args[0], TaskManager): task = args[0] elif isinstance(args[1], TaskManager): task = args[1] else: frame = inspect.getouterframes(inspect.currentframe())[1][0] try: args = inspect.getargvalues(frame) task = args.locals['task'] finally: # don't leak stack frames del frame
deleted_lines: task = args[0] if isinstance(args[0], TaskManager) else args[1]

commit_message:
Token Revocation Extension

Base API for reporting revocation events.

The initial implementation only has support for an in memory KVS backing store
More backends are planned, specifically a SQL based. The KVS Backend will be
upgraded to use the Dogpile backed KVS stores.

The default revoke provider is a Fake Provider; it does not record anything.
It will be called from  many places in the code, and that code would be much
more verbose if it is conditional.
If the extension is removed from the pipeline, the revoke calls
will not be accessable. Thus, to use this, both add the extension to the
pipeline and add a backend other than the fake one.

Change-Id: Ida468d8a230494ba28d71574b70d5d0b6da26571

See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ================= Extension revoke ================= To enable the revoke extension: 1. Add the driver fields and values in the ``[revoke]`` section in ``keystone.conf``. 2. Add the required ``filter`` to the ``pipeline`` in ``keystone-paste.ini`` 3. Create the extension tables if using the provided sql backend. Example:: (Note: this is not yet supported, but will be shortly) ./bin/keystone-manage db_sync --extension revoke

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 20:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-openvswitch-agent/element-deps'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/commit/9d1c599c39dd60ef43785c8d5665dc3b2ad38b97', 'message': "Make neutron-openvswitch-agent run cleanup.

Whenever we install the neutron-openvswitch-agent we should
also install the ovs-cleanup utility.

1) cleanup any OVS ports created by neutron

2) Also cleanup other non-neutron created OVS ports as well. This is
 really important since we want to get a DHCP address on
 a reboot (DHCP fails early on since OVS isn't fully initialized).
 init-neutron will always move any NICs back the bridge anyway...

Change-Id: Id1fdab5337296b17865c0fff85a8852c03c7968a
"}]
commit_message:
Make neutron-openvswitch-agent run cleanup.

Whenever we install the neutron-openvswitch-agent we should
also install the ovs-cleanup utility.

1) cleanup any OVS ports created by neutron

2) Also cleanup other non-neutron created OVS ports as well. This is
 really important since we want to get a DHCP address on
 a reboot (DHCP fails early on since OVS isn't fully initialized).
 init-neutron will always move any NICs back the bridge anyway...

Change-Id: Id1fdab5337296b17865c0fff85a8852c03c7968a

commit_message:
Delete openstack-dashboard.conf before start httpd service

We need delete the openstack-dashboard.conf under /etc/httpd/conf.d
before start httpd service on fedora, redhat and centos.

Close-bug: #1270839
Change-Id: I67d71cb501b967a8de0ed41b9ff52b20585500b7

commit_message:
Add utils to work with OpenStack components

Add utils to do basic actions with nova and keystone.
We decide to store in utils/openstack/%service_name.py service
specific clients in classes named like Climate%service_name%Client.
In this classes we define service client with specific variables.
Also, we redefine __getattr__ like this:

   def __getattr__(self, name):
       fn = getattr(self.%service_name, name)
       return fn

Change-Id: I47e0d8689f1d8ca8aba0372eb5e7a4a80f2f9be5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/96/52296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import json def url_for(service_catalog, service_type, admin=False, endpoint_interface=None): """Gets url of the service to communicate throught.""" if not endpoint_interface: endpoint_interface = 'public' if admin: endpoint_interface = 'admin' service = _get_service_from_catalog(service_catalog, service_type) if service: if service_type == 'identity': endpoint = _get_identity_endpoint(service, endpoint_interface) else: endpoint = service['endpoints'][0] return endpoint['url'] else: raise Exception('Service "%s" not found' % service_type) def _get_service_from_catalog(catalog, service_type): """Parses JSON catalog string and returns info about needed service.""" if catalog: catalog = json.loads(catalog) for service in catalog: if service['type'] == service_type: return service return None def _get_identity_endpoint(identity_service, endpoint_interface): """Takes one of the identity endpoints to use.""" for endpoint in identity_service['endpoints']: if 'v3' in endpoint['url'] and \ endpoint['interface'] == endpoint_interface: return endpoint raise Exception('Api %s endpoint not found in service %s' % (endpoint_interface, identity_service['type']))

commit_message:
Switching to use VIRTUAL_ENV env variable

Attempts to use VIRTUAL_ENV by default. If it's not available then
the script attempts to use pyenv's prefix to retrieve the python
environment path.

Change-Id: I45597a8736ca70ae935da59b24eac4e5ff7d6091
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/51/66251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VENV_DIR=${BARBICAN_VENV:-`pyenv prefix`}

set DIB_REPOLOCATION_<project> for projects

Once set disk-image-create will pull dependencies from local disk.

added_lines: # set DIB_REPOLOCATION_<project> for each of the projects cloned by devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh # built images will then pull git repository dependencies from local disk. for GITDIR in $(ls -d /opt/stack/new/*/.git) ; do PROJDIR=${GITDIR%/.git} PROJNAME=${PROJDIR##*/} PROJNAME=${PROJNAME//[-.]/_} export DIB_REPOLOCATION_$PROJNAME=$PROJDIR done

commit_message:
Add watchdog device support to libvirt driver

This commit adds support for watchdog devices
to the libvirt driver.  The watchdog device
used is 'i6300esb', and the action is based
on the 'watchdog:action' extra spec of the flavor,
or the 'watchdog:action' property of the image
(which will override the flavor value if present).

This is the second commit introducing watchdog devices

Implements: blueprint libvirt-watchdog

Change-Id: I3d1b472937e7143b6be25085090c98d71b224689
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/67264/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class LibvirtConfigGuestWatchdog(LibvirtConfigGuestDevice): def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(LibvirtConfigGuestWatchdog, self).__init__(root_name="watchdog", **kwargs) self.model = 'i6300esb' self.action = 'reset' def format_dom(self): dev = super(LibvirtConfigGuestWatchdog, self).format_dom() dev.set('model', self.model) dev.set('action', self.action) return dev

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

commit_message:
Catch OSError in processutils

Some gate failures showed that subprocess.Popen.communicate() may raise
an OSError where the proper response is to just call it again.  This
patch adds that handling.

Change-Id: Ibca16d2141ca3aacacc73062757c97a3220bd02d
Closes-bug: #1271331
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/75/68275/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import errno while True: try: if process_input is not None: result = obj.communicate(process_input) else: result = obj.communicate() except OSError as e: if e.errno in (errno.EAGAIN, errno.EINTR): continue raise break
deleted_lines: if process_input is not None: result = obj.communicate(process_input) else: result = obj.communicate()

commit_message:
Print task information when creating task from CLI

Summary line is printed when task has been created but not started,
detailed information is printed once the task has completed.

Change-Id: I8a3cbb81d7fccffe158517d3023ad47d28d7ebc1

commit_message:
Fix E501 in individual openstack projects

In different individual projects length of domain value differs, so sometimes
it's causing failure of pep8, because line of definition is longer
than 80 symbols.

Fix bug: 1271625

Change-Id: Ifb57ff99769b0e576697190ee80f33b00fe5644b

commit_message:
Allow a on_load_failure_callback to be provided

When entrypoints are loaded it is sometimes useful
to be able to do more than LOG the failure that could
be emitted from the plugin failing to be constructed,
allowing the manager classes to be provided a callback
that can be called when such extension fails to load
is useful to track these types of failures.

Change-Id: Idc7e55ade6b3f80c348123fbceea64425d7d3508
